text: If you want good things to happen to you: listen, think and practice self-control.

author: Margaret Anderson

author: Phyllis Theroux

author: Anita Loos
text: Fate keeps happening.

author: Maxwell Maltz

text: Honor your commitments with integrity.

text: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.

author: Mother Teresa
text: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: I live in the present. I only remember the past, and anticipate the future.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: Our self image, strongly held, essentially determines what we become.

author: Les Brown
text: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.

author: Anais Nin
text: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: Man maintains his balance, poise, and sense of security only as he is moving forward.

author: Les Brown
text: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dreams.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: The person who seeks all their applause from outside has their happiness in another's keeping.

author: Rita Davenport
text: What I think about, I bring about. The thought of success will foster success. The thought of love will foster love. The thought of security will foster security. What am I thinking about today?

author: Stuart Wilde
text: Our life's journey of self-discovery is not a straight line rise from one level of consciousness to another. Instead, it is a series of steep climbs and flat plateaus, then further climbs. Even though we all approach the journey from different directions, certain of the journey's characteristics are common to all of us.

author: Dag Hammarskiold
text: We are not permitted to choose the frame of our destiny, but what we put into it is ours.

author: Harriet Rubin
text: Freedom is actually a bigger game than power. Power is about what you can control. Freedom is about what you can unleash.

author: Rich DiGirolamo
text: The easiest success measurement tool is a simple question. What did you do today to move forward? The easiest project plan on earth is also a simple question. What will you do tomorrow to move forward? At the end of each day, document your success and design your next move.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: For imagination sets the goal picture which our automatic mechanism works on. We act, or fail to act, not because of will, as is so commonly believed, but because of imagination.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: You cannot tailor-make the situations in life but you can tailor-make the attitudes to fit those situations.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Confidence on the outside begins by living with integrity on the inside.

author: Jon Kabat-Zinn
text: Generosity is another quality which, like patience, letting go, non-judging, and trust, provides a solid foundation for mindfulness practice. You might experiment with using the cultivation of generosity as a vehicle for deep self-observation and inquiry as well as an exercise in giving. A good place to start is with yourself. See if you can give yourself gifts that may be true blessings, such as self-acceptance, or some time each day with no purpose. Practice feeling deserving enough to accept these gifts without obligation to simply receive from yourÂ­self, and from the universe.

author: W. L. Shirer
text: Most true happiness comes from one's inner life, from the disposition of the mind and soul. Admittedly, a good inner life is hard to achieve, especially in these trying times. It takes reflection and contemplation and self-discipline.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap, but by the seeds you plant.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.

author: Proust
text: The true voyage of discovery consists not of seeking new landscapes, but having new eyes.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: Close scrutiny will show that most 'crisis situations' are opportunities to either advance, or stay where you are.

author: Helen Keller
text: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.

author: Doug Evelyn
text: Long-range planning works best in the short term.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.

author: Paul J. Meyer
text: Enter every activity without giving mental recognition to the possibility of defeat. Concentrate on your strengths, instead of your weaknesses... on your powers, instead of your problems.

author: Michael J. Hurd
text: Genuine security arises from actual, firsthand knowledge that one is both capable and worthy of achieving happiness (through conscious, responsible action) and, once having attained it, that he deserves it.

author: Marianne Williamson
text: We are not held back by the love we didn't receive in the past, but by the love we're not extending in the present.

author: Lao Tzu
text: If you look to others for fulfillment, you will never be fulfilled. If your happiness depends on money, you will never be happy with yourself. Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the world belongs to you.

author: Elaine St. James
text: Maintaining a complicated life is a great way to avoid changing it.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: Accept yourself as you are. Otherwise you will never see opportunity. You will not feel free to move toward it; you will feel you are not deserving.

author: James A. Pike
text: A man needs self-acceptance or he can't live with himself; he needs self-criticism or others can't live with him.

author: C.E. Flynn
text: A man is as great as the dreams he dreams, As great as the love he bears; As great as the values he redeems, And the happiness he shares. A man is as great as the thoughts he thinks, As the worth he has attained; As the fountains at which his spirit drinks And the insight he has gained. A man is as great as the truth he speaks, As great as the help he gives, As great as the destiny he seeks, As great as the life he lives.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: It isn't what you have, or who you are, or where you are, or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about.

author: Anais Nin
text: And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.

author: Stephen Covey
text: Once you have a clear picture of your priorities that is values, goals, and high leverage activities organize around them.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Strange is our situation here upon earth. Each of us comes for a short visit, not knowing why, yet sometimes seeming to divine a purpose. From the standpoint of daily life, however, there is one thing we do know that man is here for the sake of other men.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone.

author: Jamie Winship
text: Nothing carries more potential for change than individual acts of human kindness.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.

author: George Bernard Shaw
text: Life is no 'brief candle' to me. It is a sort of splendid torch which I've got to hold up for the moment, and I want to make it burn as brightly as possible before handing it on to future generations.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: Success is the maximum utilization of the ability that you have.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Desire is the starting point of all achievement, not a hope, not a wish, but a keen pulsating desire which transcends everything.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: What we notice is what resonates with our inner perspective. We tend to overlook what does not connect with our current attitude or sense of awareness. When it comes to a tragic occurrence, do we focus on the horror stories or on the stories of courage and support? Both are available to us.

author: Daisaku Ideda
text: With love and patience, nothing is impossible.

author: Nicholas Murray Butler
text: Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and true progress.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: The strongest oak of the forest is not the one that is protected from the storm and hidden from the sun. It's the one that stands in the open where it is compelled to struggle for its existence against the winds and rains and the scorching sun.

author: Robert Kiyosaki
text: The poor, the unsuccessful, the unhappy, the unhealthy are the ones who use the word tomorrow the most

author: Anotole France
text: The first virtue of all really great men is that they are sincere. They eradicate hypocrisy from their hearts.

author: Orison Swett Marden
text: There are powers inside of you which, if you could discover and use, would make of you everything you ever dreamed or imagined you could become.

author: Marianne Williamson
text: The practice of forgiveness is our most important contribution to the healing of the world.

author: Nolan Bushnell
text: Everyone who has ever taken a shower has had an idea. It's the person who gets out of the shower, dries off, and does something about it that makes a difference.

author: Sudie Back
text: Be curious always! For knowledge will not acquire you: you must acquire it.

author: Marianne Williamson
text: The only time you ever have in which to learn anything or see anything or feel anything, or express any feeling or emotion, or respond to an event, or grow, or heal, is this moment, because this is the only moment any of us ever gets. You're only here now; you're only alive in this moment.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.

author: Jon Kabat Zinn
text: Generosity is another quality which, like patience, letting go, non-judging, and trust, provides a solid foundation for mindfulness practice.

author: Herbert Kaufman
text: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage 'coaches' ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.

author: Brian Tracy
text: When you engage in systematic, purposeful action, using and stretching your abilities to the maximum, you cannot help but feel positive and confident about yourself.

author: John Ruskin
text: In every person who comes near you look for what is good and strong.

author: Frank Knox
text: I believe with all my heart that civilization has produced nothing finer than a man or woman who thinks and practices true tolerance.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: There is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: Always remember that problems contain values that have improvement potential.

author: Red Skeleton
text: Our principles are the springs of our actions. Our actions, the springs of our happiness or misery. Too much care, therefore, cannot be taken in forming our principles.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: There's always a way if you're committed.

author: William Mather Lewis
text: The abundant life does not come to those who have had a lot of obstacles removed from their path by others. It develops from within and is rooted in strong mental and moral fiber.

author: Dale Dauten
text: Forget the resolutions. Forget control and discipline, too much work. Instead try experimenting. Go in search of something to fall in love with...something about yourself, your career, your spouse.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Just as your car runs more smoothly and requires less energy to go faster and farther when the wheels are in perfect alignment, you perform better when your thoughts, feelings, emotions, goals, and values are in balance.

author: Paul Goodman
text: Enjoyment is not a goal, it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.

author: Harry S. Truman
text: I come to the office each morning and stay for long hours doing what has to be done to the best of my ability. And when you've done the best you can you can't do any better.

author: Albert Clarke
text: In our daily lives, we must see that it is not happiness that makes us grateful, but the gratefulness that makes us happy.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: Inaction breeds doubt and fear. Action breeds confidence and courage. If you want to conquer fear, do not sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.

author: J.C.F. von Schiller
text: Every man stamps his value on himself... man is made great or small by his own will.

author: Jon KabatZinn
text: The only time you ever have in which to learn anything or see anything or feel anything, or express any feeling or emotion, or respond to an event, or grow, or heal, is this moment, because this is the only moment any of us ever gets. You're only here now; you're only alive in this moment.

author: Ayn Rand
text: Happiness is that state of consciousness which proceeds from the achievement of one's values.

author: Stuart Wilde
text: Knowledge is power. The more knowledge, expertise, and connections you have, the easier it is for you to make a profit at the game of your choice.

author: David R. Hawkins
text: Simple kindness to one's self and all that lives is the most powerful transformational force of all.

author: Greg Anderson
text: Only one thing has to change for us to know happiness in our lives: where we focus our attention.

author: Robert Kiyosaki
text: Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow

author: Greg Werner
text: Dreaming is wonderful, goal setting is crucial, but action is supreme. To make something great happen you must get busy and make it happen. Take that action step today that will put you on your path to achievement.

author: Elizabeth T. King
text: I find that it is not the circumstances in which we are placed, but the spirit in which we face them, that constitutes our comfort.

author: David Lloyd George
text: Anything can be achieved in small, deliberate steps. But there are times you need the courage to take a great leap; you can't cross a chasm in two small jumps.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.

author: Dwight Eisenhower
text: The history of free men is never really written by chance but by choice; their choice!

author: Dale Carnegie
text: All the king's horses and all the king's men can't put the past together again. So let's remember: Don't try to saw sawdust.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Decisiveness is a characteristic of high performing men and women. Almost any decision is better than no decision at all.

author: Harry Browne
text: A great burden was lifted from my shoulders the day I realized that no one owes me anything.

author: Marsha Sinetar
text: Burning desire to be or do something gives us staying power, a reason to get up every morning or to pick ourselves up and start in again after a disappointment.

author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy
text: As we express our gratitude, we must not forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.

author: Louis Nizer
text: True religion is the life we lead, not the creed we profess.

author: Alonzo Newton Benn
text: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.

author: Chinese proverb
text: The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person doing it.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: Low self-esteem is like driving through life with your hand break on.

author: John C. Bogle
text: Rely on the ordinary virtues that intelligent, balanced human beings have relied on for centuries common sense, thrift, realistic expectations, patience, and perseverance.

author: Thomas Szasz
text: The self is not something that one finds. It is something that one creates.

author: Bernard Williams
text: Man has never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.

author: J.B. Priestly
text: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day, a fresh try, one more start, with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: More than anything else, I believe it's our decisions, not the conditions of our lives, that determine our destiny.

author: Charles B. Newcomb
text: Let us move on, and step out boldly, though it be into the night, and we can scarcely see the way.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: Many people think that if they were only in some other place, or had some other job, they would be happy. Well, that is doubtful. So get as much happiness out of what you are doing as you can and don't put off being happy until some future date.

author: Michelangelo
text: The greatest danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high and we miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.

author: Adam Smith
text: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?

author: Michael Norwood
text: A vision keeps the Wealthy Soul focused on the path and not on the boulders.

author: Sidney Madwed {American Speaker & Poet}
text: The finest gift you can give anyone is encouragement. If everyone received the encouragement they need to grow, the genius in most everyone would blossom and the world would produce abundance beyond the wildest dreams.

author: Walt Disney
text: It's always fun to do the impossible.

author: John Milton
text: He who reigns within himself and rules his passions, desires, and fears is more than a king.

author: Norvin McGranahan
text: When a man begins to understand himself he begins to live. When he begins to live he begins to understand his fellow men.

author: Nashua Cavalier
text: Man's biggest mistake is to believe that he's working for someone else.

author: Longfellow
text: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough at the gate, you are sure to wake up somebody.

author: Elmer G. Letterman
text: A man may fall many times but he won't be a failure until he says someone pushed him.

author: Josiah Quincy
text: When you have a number of disagreeable duties to perform, always do the most disagreeable first.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: When I look into the future, it's so bright it burns my eyes.

author: John D. Rockefeller
text: I do not think there is any other quality so essential to success of any kind as the quality of perseverance. It overcomes almost everything, even nature.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: It is one of the most beautiful compensations of this life that no man can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.

author: Abraham Lincoln
text: Always bear in mind, that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other thing.

author: Kent Keith
text: If you're not giving the world the best you have, what world are you saving it for?

author: Somerset Maugham
text: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.

author: Michael J. Fox
text: One's dignity may be assaulted, vandalized and cruelly mocked, but cannot be taken away unless it is surrendered.

author: Morris Adler
text: The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as we continue to live.

author: Buddha
text: We are what we think. All that we are arises with our thoughts. With our thoughts we make the world.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: A am realistic I expect miracles.

author: Chinese proverb
text: The person who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.

author: Charles Dickens
text: Let no man turn aside, ever so slightly, from the broad path of honour, on the plausible pretence that he is justified by the goodness of his end. All good ends can be worked out by good means.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: Conflict cannot survive without your participation.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: Any fool can criticize, condemn, and complain and most fools do.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
text: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself, but each one of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total of all those acts will be written the history of this generation.

author: Denis Waitley
text: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.

author: Greg Anderson
text: When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by reams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live life.

author: Mary Lou Cook
text: Creativity is inventing, experimenting, growing, taking risks, breaking rules, making mistakes, and having fun.

author: David Bach
text: Before you can really start setting financial goals, you need to determine where you stand financially.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: Are you bored with life? Then throw yourself into some work you believe in with all your heart, live for it, die for it, and you will find happiness that you had thought could never be yours.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he had imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.

author: Charles Dickens
text: I never could have done what I have done without the habits of punctuality, order, and diligence, without the determination to concentrate myself on one subject at a time.

author: T. S. Eliot
text: To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: The consciousness of loving and being loved brings a warmth and richness to life that nothing else can bring.

author: Og Mandino
text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.

author: Steven H. Coogler
text: Seek respect mainly from thyself, for it comes first from within.

author: Denis Waitley
text: All of the top achievers I know are lifelong learners... Looking for new skills, insights, and ideas. If they're not learning, they're not growing... not moving toward excellence.

author: George Bernard Shaw
text: Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world.

author: Sarah Meredith
text: Believing in yourself, is an endless destination. Believing you have failed, is the end of your journey.

author: Mark Victor Hansen
text: When your selfworth goes up, your net worth goes up with it.

author: Richard Bach
text: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough, they're yours.

author: Brian Tracy
text: The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.

author: James Lane Allen
text: The vision that you glorify in your mind, the ideal that you enthrone in your heart this you will build your life by, and this you will become.

author: Anonymous
text: There is only one success, to be able to spend your life in your own way.

author: Deepak Chopra
text: The way you think, the way you behave, the way you eat, can influence your life by 30 to 50 years.

author: Draper L. Kaufman, Jr.
text: Those who do not create the future they want must endure the future they get.

author: Vic Conant
text: If you've had wonderful family relationships, you will be able to call yourself a true success in life no matter what else you've achieved.

author: Minot Simons
text: No pleasure philosophy, no sensuality, no place nor power, no material success can for a moment give such inner satisfaction as the sense of living for good purposes, for maintenance of integrity, for the preservation of self approval.

author: Les Brown
text: Other people's opinion of you does not have to become your reality.

author: William Faulkner
text: I have found that the greatest help in meeting any problem with decency and selfrespect and whatever courage is demanded, is to know where you yourself stand. That is, to have in words what you believe and are acting from.

author: Mark Victor Hansen
text: In imagination, there's no limitation.

author: Hindu proverb
text: There is nothing noble in being superior to some other man. The true nobility is in being superior to your previous self.

author: Molly Gordon
text: Let's honor our mistakes by allowing them to teach us. Let's consider our failings to be gifts, and share them humbly with others. Let the cracks in our perfect facades let in light and air so that new life can grow through them.

author: Deepak Chopra
text: The less you open your heart to others, the more your heart suffers.

author: Ambrose Redmoon
text: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgment that something else is more important than fear.

author: Warren Buffett
text: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: People become really quite remarkable when they start thinking that they can do things. When they believe in themselves they have the first secret of success.

author: Lewis L Dunnington
text: What life means to us is determined, not so much by what life brings to us as by the attitude we bring to life; not so much by what happens to us as by our reaction to what happens.

author: Brooke Astor
text: Power is the ability to do good things for others.

author: Greg Anderson
text: When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by dreams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live life.

author: Tom Morris
text: A goal is not the same as a desire, and this is an important distinction to make. You can have a desire you don't intend to act on. But you can't have a goal you don't intend to act on.

author: Charles Buxton
text: Experience shows that success is due less to ability than to zeal. The winner is he who gives himself to his work, body and soul.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: Only the insecure strive for security.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
text: I have resolved that from this day on, I will do all the business I can honestly, have all the fun I can reasonably, do all the good I can willingly, and save my digestion by thinking pleasantly.

author: Chinese Proverb
text: It's better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.

author: Warren Buffett
text: It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you'll do things differently.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: The higher your energy level, the more efficient your body. The more efficient your body, the better you feel and the more you will use your talent to produce outstanding results.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: Never react emotionally to criticism. Analyze yourself to determine whether it is justified. If it is, correct yourself. Otherwise, go on about your business.

author: Tony Alessandra
text: Be smart, be intelligent and be informed.

author: Lisa George
text: Live, love and, be present in each moment. Each moment quickly passes by, but over time, their culmination makes for a truly fulfilled life.

author: Emanuel Swedenborg
text: Kindness is an inner desire that makes us want to do good things even if we do not get anything in return. It is the joy of our life to do them. When we do good things from this inner desire, there is kindness in everything we think, say, want and do.

author: Les Brown
text: The only limits to the possibilities in your life tomorrow are the buts you use today.

author: Woodrow Wilson
text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Confidence is a habit that can be developed by acting as if you already had the confidence you desire to have.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: Compassion does not mean to be solicitous to someone who appears to be stray, imperfect, or needy. It means to see that person as we see ourselves, as unique human beings with wants, hopes, needs, dreams, and desires.

author: Vic Conant
text: How committed are you? There is a remarkable difference between a commitment of 99% and 100%.

author: Dr Wayne Dyer
text: You'll seldom experience regret for anything that you've done. It is what you haven't done that will torment you. The message, therefore, is clear. Do it! Develop an appreciation for the present moment. Seize every second of your life and savor it. Value your present moments. Using them up in any self defeating ways means you've lost them forever.

author: Denis Waitley
text: A life lived with integrity even if it lacks the trappings of fame and fortune is a shining star in whose light others may follow in the years to come.

author: Joel A. Barker
text: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.

author: Sir John Templeton
text: If we become increasingly humble about how little we know, we may be more eager to search.

author: Les Brown
text: When you face your fear, most of the time you will discover that it was not really such a big threat after all. We all need some form of deeply rooted, powerful motivation it empowers us to overcome obstacles so we can live our dreams.

author: William James
text: It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome.

author: Jawaharlal Nehru
text: Action to be effective must be directed to clearly conceived ends.

author: David Bach
text: The more I study the wealthy.. in an effort to learn how to help more people around the world become one of them.. I'm stunned by how many people are actually not rich.

author: Marilyn Vos Savant
text: Being defeated is often a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent.

author: Peter McWilliams
text: The value of action is that we make mistakes; mistakes show us what we need to learn.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.

author: Mark Victor Hansen
text: Whatever you're ready for is ready for you.

author: William Jennings Bryan
text: Destiny is not a matter of chance, it is a matter of choice; it is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
text: We cannot put off living until we're ready. Life is fired at us point blank.

author: Sam Keen
text: We come to love not by finding a perfect person but by learning to see an imperfect person perfectly.

author: William F. Scolavino
text: The height of your accomplishments will equal the depth of your convictions.

author: Cullen Hightower
text: A true measure of your worth includes all the benefits others have gained from your successes.

author: Deepak Chopra
text: Giving connects two people, the giver and the receiver, and this connection gives birth to a new sense of belonging.

author: George Foreman
text: The question isn't at what age I want to retire, it's at what income.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: The best job goes to the person who can get it done without passing the buck or coming back with excuses.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, nor the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when he discovers that someone else believes in him and is willing to trust him with his friendship.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: The person who gets the farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare. The sure thing boat never gets far from shore.

author: Mark Twain
text: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.

author: Brian S. Wesbury
text: When freedom prevails, the ingenuity and inventiveness of people creates incredible wealth. This is the source of the natural improvement of the human condition.

author: Warren Buffett
text: Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.

author: Charles Dickens
text: Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has many not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others to succeed.

author: Unknown
text: The real measure of your wealth is how much you'd be worth if you lost all your money.

author: Ayn Rand
text: The action required to sustain human life is primarily intellectual, everything man needs has to be discovered by his mind and produced by his effort.

author: Lee Iacocca
text: No matter what you've done for yourself or for humanity, if you can't look back on having given love and attention to your own family, what have you really accomplished?

author: John Cummuta
text: Everyone who has achieved financial independence will tell you that at least in the early days you have to work smarter and harder. The price of success must be paid in full, and it must be paid in advance. There are no shortcuts.

author: Jack and Garry Kinder
text: High achievement always takes place in the framework of high expectation.

author: Clement Stone
text: There is little difference in people, but that little difference makes a big difference. The little difference is attitude. The big difference is whether it is positive or negative.

author: Earl Nightingale
text: Whats's going on in the inside shows on the outside.

author: Greg Werner
text: Your achievements in life are dependent on a simple two-step process: 1) think positive achievement thoughts, and 2) take positive actions toward those thoughts. Don't wait another second, start the process right now.

author: Henry Hoskins
text: Enthusiasm finds the opportunities, and energy makes the most of them.

author: Denis Waitley
text: We've got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: Joy increases as you give it, and diminishes as you try to keep it for yourself. In giving it, you will accumulate a deposit of joy greater than you ever believed possible.

author: Rev. Rowland C. Croucher
text: Just as friction between certain types of rocks produces sparks of light, so it is the friction of our individualities rubbing against each other that illuminates who we really are.

author: Joseph Sugarman
text: View every problem as an opportunity.

author: Louise Hay
text: The thoughts we choose to think are the tools we use to paint the canvas of our lives.

author: Stephen Covey
text: Only after we can learn to forgive ourselves can we accept others as they are because we don't feel threatened by anything about them which is better than us.

author: Conrad Hilton
text: Achievement seems to be connected with action. Successful men and women keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.

author: Will Schultz
text: Joy comes from using your potential.

author: Nido Qubein
text: Nothing can add more power to your life than concentrating all of your energies on a limited set of targets.

author: Rollo May
text: Courage is not a virtue or value among other personal values like love or fidelity. It is the foundation that underlies and gives reality to all other virtues and personal values.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: We confide in our strength, without boasting of it; we respect that of others, without fearing it.

author: Mark Victor Hansen
text: Goals are new, forward-moving objectives. They magnetize you towards them.

author: Warren Buffett
text: I don't try to jump over 7-foot bars, I look around for 1-foot bars that I can step over.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: When defeat comes, accept it as a signal that your plans are not sound. Rebuild those plans and set sail once more toward your coveted goal.

author: Unknown
text: It is better to be motivated by the soul's hunger rather than the ego's greed.

author: Ann Landers
text: Class is an aura of confidence that is being sure without being cocky. Class has nothing to do with money. Class never runs scared. It is self-discipline and self-knowledge. It's the sure-footedness that comes with having proved you can meet life.

author: David Viscott
text: You must begin to think of yourself as becoming the person you want to be.

author: D. H. Lawrence
text: Life is ours to be spent, not to be saved.

author: Stephen Covey
text: There are only two lasting bequests we can give our children... one is roots, the other wings.

author: Mark Victor Hansen
text: Big goals get big results. No goals get no results or somebody else's results.

author: Demosthenes
text: Nothing is so easy as to deceive oneself; for what we wish, we readily believe.

author: Mother Teresa
text: Life is an opportunity, benefit from it. Life is a beauty, admire it. Life is a dream, realize it. Life is a challenge, meet it. Life is a duty, complete it. Life is a game, play it. Life is a promise, fulfill it. Life is sorrow, overcome it. Life is a song, sing it. Life is a struggle, accept it. Life is a tragedy, confront it. Life is an adventure, dare it. Life is luck, make it. Life is life, fight for it!

author: Glenn Clark
text: If you wish to travel far and fast, travel light. Take off all your envies, jealousies, unforgiveness, selfishness, and fears.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: When we extend ourselves to another human being in any way at all, when we positively touch the life of one person, we benefit the whole of humanity.

author: F.A. Hayek
text: There is all the difference in the world between treating people equally and attempting to make them equal.

author: Clark Moustakas
text: Accept everything about yourself, I mean everything. You are you and that is the beginning and the endâ€”no apologies, no regrets.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

author: Denis Waitley
text: A life lived with integrity even if it lacks the trappings of fame and fortune is a shining star in whose light others may follow in the years to come.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: There is no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love to do, there is only scarcity of resolve to make it happen.

author: Henry Ford
text: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.

author: Audrey Hepburn
text: Remember, if you ever need a helping hand, you'll find one at the end of your arm ... As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.

author: David Viscott
text: The worst thing that one can do is not try, to be aware of what one wants and not give in to it, to spend years in silent hurt wondering if something could have materialized and never knowing.

author: Jerry Garcia
text: You do not merely want to be considered just the best of the best. You want to be considered the only one who does what you do.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
text: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.

author: Will Durant
text: Knowledge is power, but only wisdom is liberty.

author: Mary Pickford
text: You may have a fresh start any moment you choose, for this thing that we call 'failure' is not the falling down, but the staying down.

author: Robert Heinlein
text: The hardest part of gaining any new idea is sweeping out the false idea occupying that niche.

author: Dietrich Bonhoffer
text: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: When your desires are strong enough you will appear to possess superhuman powers to achieve.

author: J. Harold Wilkins
text: The world of achievement has always belonged to the optimist.

author: Larry Bird
text: A winner is someone who recognizes his God-given talents, works his tail off to develop them into skills, and uses these skills to accomplish his goals.

author: John Maxwell
text: A difficult time can be more readily endured if we retain the conviction that our existence holds a purposeâ€”a cause to pursue, a person to love, a goal to achieve.

author: Andrew Carnegie
text: Concentrate: put all your eggs in one basket, and watch that basket.

author: Og Mandino
text: The only certain means of success is to render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what the task may be. This is a habit followed by all successful people since the beginning of time. Therefore I say the surest way to doom yourself to mediocrity is to perform only the work for which you are paid.

author: Denis Waitley
text: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.

author: Anonymous
text: There is only one success â€“ to be able to spend your life in your own way.

author: Les Brown
text: You need to make a commitment, and once you make it, then life will give you some answers.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
text: So when you are listening to somebody, completely, attentively, then you are listening not only to the words, but also to the feeling of what is being conveyed, to the whole of it, not part of it.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Every failure brings with it the seed of an equivalent success.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
text: I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for every thing I do.

author: Giacomo Casanova
text: As for myself, I always willingly acknowledge my own self as the principal cause of every good and of every evil which may befall me; therefore I have always found myself capable of being my own pupil, and ready to love my teacher.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: We must walk consciously only part way toward our goal and then leap in the dark to our success.

author: Les Brown
text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Most misfortunes are the results of misused time.

author: Laurence J. Peter
text: Real, constructive mental power lies in the creative thought that shapes your destiny, and your hour-by-hour mental conduct produces power for change in your life. Develop a train of thought on which to ride. The nobility of your life as well as your happiness depends upon the direction in which that train of thought is going.

author: Samuel Johnson
text: Curiosity is one of the most permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous intellect.

author: Dr. David Burns
text: Aim for success not perfection... Remember that fear always lurks behind perfectionism. Confronting your fears and allowing yourself the right to be human can, paradoxically, make you a far happier and more productive person.

author: Dr. Seuss
text: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: The meeting of preparation with opportunity generates the offspring we call luck.

author: Peyton Conway March
text: There is a wonderful mythical law of nature that the three things we crave most in lifeâ€”happiness, freedom, and peace of mindâ€”are always attained by giving them to someone else.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Reduce your plan to writing... The moment you complete this, you will have definitely given concrete form to the intangible desire.

author: Edward deBono
text: The need to be right all the time is the biggest bar to new ideas. It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong than to be always right by having no ideas at all.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.

author: William H. Sheldon
text: Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere, wholeheartedly, one directionally, without regret or reservation.

author: Robert Brault
text: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.

author: Scott Reed
text: This one step, choosing a goal and sticking to it, changes everything.

author: Albert Pine
text: What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us. What we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.

author: Denis Waitley
text: Happy people plan actions, they don't plan results.

author: John Quincy Adams
text: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.

author: W. Edwards Deming
text: When asked what single event was most helpful in developing the Theory of Relativity, Albert Einstein replied, 'Figuring out how to think about the problem'.

author: Mary Anne RadmacherHershey
text: Courage doesn't always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, 'I will try again tomorrow'.

author: Calvin Coolidge
text: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful people with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan 'press on' has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race.

author: Shakti Gawain
text: When we create something, we always create it first in a thought form. If we are basically positive in attitude, expecting and envisioning pleasure, satisfaction and happiness, we will attract and create people, situations, and events which conform to our positive expectations.

author: Earl Nightingale
text: People with goals succeed because they know where they are going... It's as simple as that.

author: Anonymous
text: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.

author: Leo Burnett
text: To swear off making mistakes is very easy. All you have to do is swear off having ideas.

author: E.M. Gray
text: The successful person has the habit of doing the things failures don't like to do. They don't like doing them either necessarily. But their disliking is subordinated to the strength of their purpose.

author: Stedman Graham
text: Having a vision for your life allows you to live out of hope, rather than out of your fears.

author: Robert Collier
text: Visualize this thing you want. See it, feel it, believe in it. Make your mental blueprint and begin.

author: Joseph Joubert
text: The aim of an argument or discussion should not be victory, but progress.

author: Mother Teresa
text: The first step to becoming is to will it.

author: Anonymous
text: Hard things are put in our way, not to stop us, but to call out our courage and strength.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: While we may not be able to control all that happens to us, we can control what happens inside us.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: Know what you want to do, hold the thought firmly, and do every day what should be done, and every sunset will see you that much nearer the goal.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
text: Let me not pray to be sheltered from dangers, but to be fearless in facing them. Let me not beg for the stilling of my pain, but for the heart to conquer it.

author: Ben Stein
text: The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want.

author: F.W. Faber
text: Remember that if the opportunities for great deeds should never come, the opportunities for good deeds are renewed day by day. The thing for us to long for is the goodness, not the glory.

author: Denis Waitley
text: The secret to productive goal setting is in establishing clearly defined goals, writing them down and then focusing on them several times a day with words, pictures and emotions as if we've already achieved them.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
text: To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end in life.

author: Nathaniel Branden
text: Persons of high selfesteem are not driven to make themselves superior to others; they do not seek to prove their value by measuring themselves against a comparative standard. Their joy is being who they are, not in being better than someone else.

author: Michael Gerber
text: The problem with most failing businesses is not that their owners don't know enough about finance, marketing, management, and operations they don't, but those things are easy enough to learn but that they spend their time and energy defending what they think they know. My experience has shown me that the people who are exceptionally good in business aren't so because of what they know but because of their insatiable need to know more.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.

author: Tom Blandi
text: Our attitudes control our lives. Attitudes are a secret power working 24 hours a day, for good or bad. It is of paramount importance that we know how to harness and control this great force.

author: W.J. Slim
text: When you cannot make up your mind which of two evenly balanced courses of action you should take choose the bolder.

author: Richard M. DeVos
text: The only thing that stands between a man and what he wants from life is often merely the will to try it and the faith to believe that it is possible.

author: Epictetus
text: He is a man of sense who does not grieve for what he has not, but rejoices in what he has.

author: Earl Nightingale
text: You become what you think about.

author: Kathy Smith
text: Your choices today determine your tomorrow and you make your life through the power of choice.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right'. Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing that's why we recommend it daily.

author: Herbert Kaufman
text: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage 'coaches' ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.

author: Donald A. Adams
text: To give real service you must add something which cannot be bought or measured with money, and that is sincerity and integrity.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: Do not be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment.

author: Julia Sorel
text: If you're never scared or embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take any chances.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
text: It is the heart that makes a man rich. He is rich according to what he is, not according to what he has.

author: Phillips Brooks
text: Some day, in years to come, you will be wrestling with the great temptation, or trembling under the great sorrow of your life. But the real struggle is here, now, in these quiet weeks. Now it is being decided whether, in the day of your supreme sorrow or temptation, you shall miserably fail or gloriously conquer. Character cannot be made except by a steady, long continued process.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
text: Confidence....thrives only on honesty, on honor, on the sacredness of obligations, on faithful protection and on unselfish performance. Without them, it cannot live.

author: Ben Stein
text: You can do what you think you can do and you cannot do what you think you cannot do.

author: George E. Allen
text: People of mediocre ability sometimes achieve outstanding success because they don't know when to quit. Most people succeed because they are determined to.

author: Mia Hamm
text: You may get skinned knees and elbows, but it's worth it if you score a spectacular goal.

author: Henri Bergson
text: To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly.

author: Thomas A. Edison
text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.

author: Brian Griese
text: There's lots of opportunities out there in life, but if you never put yourself out on a limb and take chances you'll never dare to be great at anything.

author: Ralph W. Sockman
text: The larger the island of knowledge, the longer the shoreline of wonder.

author: Sarah Ban Breathnach
text: Just as negative addictions sneak up on us a day at a time, so do positive cravings. Meditation, creative movement, moments of selfÂ­nurturance that bring contentment all can become positive habits of wellbeing.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.

author: George Santayana
text: Habit is stronger than reason.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
text: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.

author: Jimmy Durante
text: If you want the rainbow, you've got to put up with the rain.

author: Erica Jong
text: If you don't risk anything, you risk even more.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
text: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength.

author: Michael Bartel
text: Happiness is a conscious choice, not an automatic response.

author: Ayn Rand
text: Men have been taught that it is a virtue to agree with others. But the creator is the man who disagrees. Men have been taught that it is a virtue to swim with the current. But the creator is the man who goes against the current. Men have been taught that it is a virtue to stand together. But the creator is the man who stands alone.

author: Muhammad Ali
text: The one without dreams is the one without wings.

author: Nathaniel Branden
text: Sometimes the subconscious mind manifests a wisdom several steps or even years ahead of the conscious mind, and has its own way of leading us toward our destiny.

author: Lao Tzu
text: The journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.

author: Edward R. Lyman
text: Principle can never be a weathervane, spinning around this way and that with the shifting winds of expediency. Principle is a compass forever fixed and forever true.

author: Elvis Presley
text: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it's not going to go away.

author: Winston Churchill
text: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.

author: Robert F Kennedy
text: It is from numberless diverse acts of courage and belief that human history is shaped. Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends a tiny ripple of hope, and crossing each other from a million different centers of energy and daring those ripples build a current which can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance.

author: Phillips Brooks
text: No man or woman of the humblest sort can really be strong, gentle and good, without the world being better for it, without somebody being helped and comforted by the very existence of that goodness.

author: William Faulkner
text: Don't bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.

author: John Cummuta
text: Everyone who has achieved financial independence will tell you that - at least in the early days you have to work smarter and harder. The price of success must be paid in full, and it must be paid in advance. There are no shortcuts.

author: Ruth McKenney
text: Man has no nobler function than to defend the truth.

author: W. Clement Stone
text: You always do what you want to do. This is true with every act. You may say that you had to do something, or that you were forced to, but actually, whatever you do, you do by choice. Only you have the power to choose for yourself.

author: Samuel Johnson
text: Nothing will ever be attempted, if all possible objections must first be overcome.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.

author: Unknown
text: Life is full of endings, but every ending is a new beginning.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: Forgiveness is giving up the hope that the past could be any different.

author: Seneca
text: Nature does not bestow virtue; to be good is an art.

author: Nietzsche
text: You can bear any how if you have a why.

author: William Frederick Halsey, Jr.
text: There are no great people in this world, only great challenges which ordinary people rise to meet.

author: Vash Young
text: Any experience can be transformed into something of value.

author: Victor Robinsoll
text: There is much satisfaction in work well done, but there can be no happiness equal to the joy of finding a heart that understands.

author: Jim Rohn
text: Time is our most valuable asset, yet we tend to waste it, kill it, and spend it rather than invest it.

author: Vince Lombardi
text: Individual commitment to a group effort - that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.

author: Harvey Mackay
text: Goals give you more than a reason to get up in the morning; they are an incentive to keep you going all day. Goals tend to tap the deeper resources and draw the best out of life.

author: Paul J. Meyer
text: Mistakes are merely steps up the ladder...

author: John D. Rockefeller
text: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.

author: Samuel Butler
text: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.

author: Julie V. Watson
text: Dreams not pursued by action are simply that, dreams with little prospect of being attained. Action taken without a plan or direction is simply that action with little prospect of success. Tie the plan and the action together and the dreams can become reality.

author: Louis A. Allen
text: The greatest potential of control tends to exist at the point where action takes place.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: Do your work with your whole heart and you will succeedâ€”there's so little competition.

author: Aristotle
text: Excellence is an art won by training and habituation. We do not act rightly because we have virtue or excellence, but rather we have those because we have acted rightly. We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.

author: George S. Patton
text: A good plan today is better than a great plan tomorrow.

author: Jameson Frank
text: Our greatest battles are that with our own minds.

author: Jim Rohn
text: We must all suffer from one of two pains: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret. The difference is discipline weighs ounces while regret weighs tons.

author: Alan Alda
text: You have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover is yourself.

author: Leo F. Buscaglia
text: Don't spend your precious time asking 'Why isn't the world a better place?' It will only be time wasted. The question to ask is 'How can I make it better?' To that there is an answer.

author: Wang YangMing
text: The sages do not consider that making no mistakes is a blessing. They believe, rather, that the great virtue of man lies in his ability to correct his mistakes and continually make a new man of himself.

author: Andrew Carnegie
text: As I grow older, I pay less attention to what men say. I just watch what they do.

author: Anonymous
text: People with small minds talk about other people. People with average minds talk about events. People with great minds talk about ideas

author: Chinese proverb
text: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.

author: The Dalai Lama
text: Every day, think as you wake up, today I am fortunate to be alive, I have a precious human life, I am not going to waste it. I am going to use all my energies to develop myself, to expand my heart out to others; to achieve enlightenment for the benefit of all beings. I am going to have kind thoughts towards others, I am not going to get angry or think badly about others. I am going to benefit others as much as I can.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: For here we are not afraid to follow the truth wherever it may lead...

author: Ann Landers
text: Be able to stick with a job until it is finished. Be able to bear an injustice without having to get even. Be able to carry money without spending it. Do your duty without being supervised.

author: Jim Rohn
text: Success is neither magical or mysterious. Success is the natural consequence of consistently applying the basic fundamentals.

author: Eric Allenbaugh
text: Maintaining a comfort zone can, paradoxically, lead to discomfort in the long run.

author: David Lloyd George
text: The finest eloquence is that which gets things done.

author: Marianne Williamson
text: In every community, there is work to be done. In every nation, there are wounds to heal. In every heart, there is the power to do it.

author: Clare Booth Luce
text: In the final analysis there is no solution to man's progress but the day's honest work, the day's honest decisions, the day's generous utterances and the day's good deed.

author: Barbara DeAngelis
text: Love is a force more formidable than any other. It is invisible, it cannot be seen or measured, yet it is powerful enough to transform you in a moment, and offer you more joy than any material possession could.

author: Katharine Hepburn
text: Without discipline, there's no life at all.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
text: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.

author: Sir John Templeton
text: Wherever we are and whatever we are doing, it is possible to learn something that can enrich our lives and the lives of others... No one's education is ever complete.

author: Belva Davis
text: Don't be afraid of the space between your dreams and reality. If you can dream it, you can make it so.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: Dignity and Respect has to do with what you are ready, willing, and able to accept within yourself and in accepting to be able to give others. It is your personal power to make a difference by being true to the best within you and letting that truth shine through your words and actions.

author: Herbert N. Casson
text: Every winner has scars.

author: Ayn Rand
text: Wealth is the product of man's ability to think.

author: G. W. F. Hegel
text: Thus to be independent of public opinion is the first formal condition of achieving anything great.

author: Carl Rogers
text: The only person who cannot be helped is that person who blames others.

author: Samuel Goldwyn
text: When someone does something good, applaud! You will make two people happy.

author: Dr. Wayne Dyer
text: Abundance is not something we acquire. It is something we tune into.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: A human being feels able and competent only so long as he is permitted to contribute as much as, or more, than he has contributed to him.

author: Barbara De Angelis
text: No matter what age you are, or what your circumstances might be, you are special, and you still have something unique to offer. Your life, because of who you are, has meaning.

author: F. W. Nichol
text: When you get right down to the root of the meaning of the word 'succeed,' you find that it simply means to follow through.

author: Mark Twain
text: Plan for the future, because that is where you are going to spend the rest of your life.

author: Lin Yutang
text: It is not so much what you believe in that matters, it's more the way in which you believe it and proceed to translate that belief into action.

author: Satchel Paige
text: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.

author: Heraclitus
text: The soul is dyed the color of its thoughts. Think only on those things that are in line with your principles and can bear the light of day. The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you choose, what you think, and what you do is who you become. Your integrity is your destiny ... it is the light that guides your way.

author: Grover Cleveland
text: Unswerving loyalty to duty, constant devotion to truth, and a clear conscience will overcome every discouragement and surely lead the way to usefulness and high achievement.

author: Mikhail Strabo
text: Knowing that you have complete control of your thinking you will recognize the power...

author: Henry Ford
text: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.

author: Adlai Stevenson
text: We can chart our future clearly and wisely only when we know the path which has led to the present.

author: King Solomon
text: Wisdom is a shelter as money is a shelter, but the advantage of knowledge is this: that wisdom preserves the life of its possessor.

author: Chinese Proverb
text: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.

author: Bill Vaughan
text: An optimist stays up until midnight to see the new year in. A pessimist stays up to make sure the old year leaves.

author: Ludwig von Mises
text: Society is joint action and cooperation in which each participant sees the other partner's success as a means for the attainment of his own.

author: James Burke
text: The key to why things change is the key to everything.

author: Bhagavadgita
text: A man's own self is his friend, a man's own self is his foe.

author: Epictetus
text: Any person capable of angering you becomes your master; he can anger you only when you permit yourself to be disturbed by him.

author: Harry Emerson Fosdick
text: One must have the adventurous daring to accept oneself as a bundle of possibilities and undertake the most interesting game in the world making the most of one's best.

author: Washington Irving
text: Great minds have purposes, others have wishes.

author: Charles Buxton
text: In life, as in chess, forethought wins.

author: James Buckham
text: Trials, temptations, disappointments all these are helps instead of hindrances, if one uses them rightly. They not only test the fiber of a character, but strengthen it. Every conquered temptation represents a new fund of moral energy. Every trial endured and weathered in the right spirit makes a soul nobler and stronger than it was before.

author: Henry Ford
text: If money is your hope for independence you will never have it. The only real security that a man will have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience, and ability.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: For everything you have missed, you have gained something else; and for everything you gain, you lose something else.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: In the long run, we shape our lives, and we shape ourselves. The process never ends until we die. And the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.

text: Quality questions create a quality life. Businesses succeed when their decision makers ask the right questions about product lines or markets or strategic planning. Relationships flourish when people ask the right questions about where potential conflicts exist and how to support each other rather than tearing each other down. Communities benefit when leaders ask the right questions about what is most important and how citizens can work together toward shared goals. For whatever area of your life you want to improve, there are questions you can ask that will provide you with answers solutions that can catapult you and those you love to a higher level of success and enjoyment. Do you need to ask questions about quality? commitment? contribution?

author: Anthony Robbins
text: The action signal of anger, annoyance, resentment, or rage is a powerful emotion. Its source is feelings of hurt that have not been dealt with. This action signal tells us that one of our important standards, or rules, has been violated by ourselves or someone else. The Solution 1) Realize you may have misinterpreted, and the person you believe has 'broken your rules' may not even know they've broken them. 2) Realize that your rules are not necessarily the 'right' rules (sometimes that's hard to do). 3) Interrupt the anger by asking yourself such questions as 'In the long run, is it true that this person really cares about me? What can I learn from this? How can I communicate the importance of my standards?'

author: Successories
text: You cannot discover oceans unless you have the courage to leave the shore.

author: Gerry Spence
text: I would rather have a mind opened by wonder than one closed by belief.

author: Charles M. Schwab
text: I was once asked if a big business man ever reached his objectives. I replied that if a man ever reached his objective he was not a big business man.

author: Unknown
text: The best gifts are tied with heartstrings.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: Help us to be thankful for this day and every day and treat each one as a precious gem to be filled to the full with meaning and with love.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.

author: Anonymous
text: Progress involves risk. You can't steal second base and keep your foot on first base.

author: Stephen R. Covey
text: Win-win agreements are tremendously liberating. But as the product of isolated techniques, they won't hold up. Even if you set them up in the beginning, there is no way to maintain them without personal integrity and a relationship of trust.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: How does a person make a difference? The history of the world is simply a chronicle of the deeds of a small number of ordinary people who had extraordinary levels of commitment. Those individuals who had the power to make a meaningful difference in the quality of our lives are the men and women we call heroes. Who are your heroes?

author: Sir James M. Barrie
text: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one has to do.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Your incredible brain can take you from rags to riches, from loneliness to popularity and from depression to happiness and joy if you use it properly.

author: Larry King
text: Getting your house in order and reducing the confusion gives you more control over your life. Personal organization some how releases or frees you to operate more effectively.

author: William George Jordan
text: Real success in life means the individual's conquest of himself; it means how he has bettered himself not how he has bettered his fortune. The great question of life is not 'What have I?' but 'What am I?'

author: Anthony Robbins
text: What would happen to your stress level if you consistently thought about dealing with various challenges in terms of 'climbing the ladder of success' rather than 'struggling to keep my head above water'? Would you feel different about taking a test if you talked about 'sailing' through it rather than 'flailing'? Would your perception of time change if you talked about it 'flying' rather than 'crawling'? You bet it would! What metaphors do you use to describe the things you do every day? How do they make you feel? What new metaphors could you use to be more effective and make life more enjoyable?

author: Albert Einstein
text: There are only two ways to live your life. One as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.

author: Chaim Potok
text: A man must fill his life with meaning, meaning is not automatically given to life. It is hard work to fill one's life with meaning.

author: Thomas Paine
text: That which we obtain too easily, we esteem too lightly.

author: Raquel Welch
text: Once you get rid of the idea that you must please other people before you please yourself, and you begin to follow your own instincts only then can you be successful. You become more satisfied, and when you are other people tend to be satisfied by what you do.

author: Cicero
text: Friendship makes prosperity more brilliant, and lightens adversity by dividing and sharing it.

author: Edwin Land
text: Creativity is the sudden cessation of stupidity.

author: James Francis Byrnes
text: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.

author: Gary Ryan Blair
text: As the clich'e goes, 'The best defense is a good offense.' Go forward be aggressive. Don't give your fears or competition a chance to pin you down. Trepidation and loss of confidence come with a defensive posture. Attack the problem, attack the market, attack the competition, and you are proceeding positively. Fear will melt and confidence will rise.

author: Deepak Chopra
text: The meaning that you give an event is the event.

author: Walter Brunell
text: Failure is the tuition you pay for success.

author: Confucius
text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

author: unknown
text: Lack of concentration of effort: The jack-of-all trades seldom is good at any. Concentrate all of your efforts on one definite chief aim.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.

author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
text: Surprising things can happen to anyone who, when a disagreeable or discouraged thought comes into his [or her] mind, just has the sense to remember in time and push it out by putting in an agreeable, determinedly courageous one. Two things cannot be in one place.

author: William James
text: Genius means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.

author: M.H. McKee
text: Integrity is one of several paths. It distinguishes itself from the others because it is the right path, and the only one upon which you will never get lost.

author: Dr. Dennis Deaton
text: Quiet your mind and picture yourself attaining your dream. . . . Without even realizing it, your confidence soars and you become a magnet for Good things.

author: Eskimo proverb
text: May you have warmth in your igloo, oil in your lamp, and peace in your heart.

author: Duke Ellington
text: A problem is your chance to do your best.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: Valor consists in the power of self recovery.

author: Confucius
text: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.

author: Lauren Hill
text: There have been too many things that have happened in my life to look at anything as coincidence.

author: Dr. Joyce Brothers
text: In each of us are places where we have never gone. Only by pressing the limits do you ever find them.

author: Ben Franklin
text: Hide not your talents. They for use were made. What's a sundial in the shade?

author: Karen Lamb
text: A year from now you may wish you had started today.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Whatever the mind of man can conceive and believe, he can achieve.

author: Joseph Chilton Pearce
text: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: An important question to answer whenever we consistently feel pain in our lives is, 'Is this pain the result of my situation or of my rules for how I should feel about it? Is my feeling bad about this making it better? What rule (belief) must I have in order to feel bad in this situation?' It's critical to examine our rules to make certain they're intelligent and appropriate. Some people's rules for feeling good are that their children must be getting straight A's in school, they must be ns1 in their office in sales, have less than 10 percent body fat, and feel calm and unstressed at all times! Can you imagine how often someone with these rules would feel good? Examine your rules. Make sure they serve you!

author: Erich Fromm
text: The quest for certainty blocks the search for meaning. Uncertainty is the very condition to impel man to unfold his powers.

author: J.P. Hughston
text: For me, a painting is like a story which stimulates the imagination and draws the mind into a place filled with expectation, excitement, wonder and pleasure.

author: Dr. Phil McGraw
text: We are creatures of habit, and we do what we know how to do. And if you're gonna change the momentum in your life, then something dramatic has to happen to get you to change that.

author: Bob McElwain
text: What crazy idea do you have down deep inside that makes people chuckle or laugh every time you bring it up? However wild it may be, no matter how many scoff at it, risk a little time and a few bucks. You may be able to demonstrate you were right after all. And you'll be on your way to success.

author: Barbara Reinhold
text: Change is not a process for the impatient.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: Winning is not everything, but the effort to win is.

author: Anonymous
text: Success comes before work only in the dictionary.

author: Epictetus
text: Circumstances do not make the man; they merely reveal him to himself.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Success comes to those who become success conscience. Failure comes to those who indifferently allow themselves to become failure conscience.

author: Shirley Lord
text: What really matters is what you do with what you have.

author: Carl Sandburg
text: Nothing happens unless first a dream!

author: Doanld Curts
text: We are what and where we are because we have first imagined it.

author: Dalai Lama
text: In the practice of tolerance, one's enemy is the best teacher.

author: Voltaire
text: Work banishes those three great evils: boredom, vice and poverty.

author: Viktor Frankl
text: Everyone has his own specific vocation or mission in life . . . Therein he cannot be replaced, nor can his life be repeated. Thus, everyone's task is as unique as is his specific opportunity to implement it.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: Don't put off joy and happiness. To so many people, goal setting means that only someday, after they've achieved something great, will they be able to enjoy life. There's a huge difference between achieving to be happy and happily achieving. Strive to live each day to its fullest, squeezing all the joy you can out of each moment. Instead of measuring your life's value by your progress toward a single goal, remember that the direction you're headed in is more important than temporary results. What is your current direction? Are you moving toward your goals or away from them? Do you need to make a course correction? Are you enjoying life to the fullest? If not, make a change in one of these areas now.

author: Dee W. Hock
text: We tend to fall in love with the things that we think are true.

author: Plutarch
text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.

author: St. Teresa of Avila
