text: Learn to self-conquest, persevere thus for a time, and you will perceive very clearly the advantage which you gain from it.

author: Michelangelo
text: The marble not yet carved can hold the form of every thought the greatest artist has.

author: Easton Robert
text: Once people learn something, they're reluctant to let it go

author: Gabriel Heatter
text: More power than all the success slogans ever penned by human hand is the realization for every man that he has but one boss. That boss is the man he himself.

author: Dave Sharkey
text: Listen regularly to customers and employees. Create an atmosphere of utmost trust and credibility. Employees have to know that every decision, direction and redirection is for the Greater Good. You need that level of trust to change the direction of the company on a dime, which in this business, you sometimes need to do.

author: Sir Winston Churchill
text: We shall fight on the beaches. We shall fight on the landing grounds. We shall fight in the fields, and in the streets, we shall fight in the hills. We shall never surrender!

author: Anthony Robbins
text: What changes your life is not learning more. What changes your life is making decisions and using your personal power and taking action.

author: Francis Bacon
text: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.

author: Dean Tjosvold
text: In cooperation, people realize that they are successful when others succeed and are oriented toward aiding each other to perform effectively. They encourage each other because they understand the other's priorities help them to be successful. Compatible goals promote trust. People expect help and assistance from others and are confident that they can rely on others; it is, after all, in others' self-interest to help. Expecting to get and give assistance, they accurately disclose their intentions and feelings, offer ideas and resources, and request aid. They are able to work out arrangements of exchange that leave all better off. These interactions result in friendliness, cohesion and high moral.

author: W. Edwards Deming
text: Quality is everyone's responsibility.

author: Unknown
text: Virtually anything you could ever want to be, have or do is achievable with learning and hard work.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: When you were born, you cried and the world rejoiced. Live your life in such a manner that when you die the world cries and you rejoice.

author: John Fletcher
text: Deeds, not words shall speak to me.

author: Warren Buffet
text: Bad habits are like chains that are too light to feel until they are too heavy to carry.

author: Milton Berle
text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.

author: Les Brown
text: When life knocks you down, try to land on your back. Because if you can look up, you can get up. Let your reason get you back up.

author: Stephen Leacock
text: I am a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.

author: Stephen R. Covey
text: In win-win performance agreements, consequences become the natural or logical result of performance rather than a reward or punishment arbitrarily handed out by the person in charge.

author: Gordon MacKenzie
text: If you go to your grave without painting your masterpiece, it will not get painted. No one else can paint it only you.

author: Solomon
text: He that answers a matter before he hears, it is folly and shame unto him.

author: Carl Hiaasen
text: Humor can be an incredible, lacerating and effective weapon.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: All personal breakthroughs begin with a change in beliefs. How do you replace limiting beliefs? The most effective way is to destabilize your old belief shake your certainty by questioning it. Remember that your brain is always trying to move you away from pain, so think about all the negative consequences this belief has caused. Ask yourself: 1) As I reconsider it, what's actually silly, ridiculous, or stupid about this belief? 2) What has this belief already cost me? How has it limited me in the past? 3) What could it cost me in the future if I don't change now? Answering these types of questions will help you associate painful feelings to the old, undesired belief and provide you with the opportunity to replace it with an empowering one.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Success comes when you do what you love to do, and commit to being the best in your field.

author: Unknown
text: Never look back unless you are planning to go that way.

author: William Shakespeare
text: When the sea was calm all ships alike showed mastership in floating.

author: John Wesley
text: Though I am always in haste, I am never in a hurry because I never undertake more work than I can go through with calmness of spirit.

author: Samuel Johnson
text: Pleasure that is obtained by unreasonable and unsuitable cost, must always end in pain.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: It is neither wealth nor splendor; but tranquillity and occupation which give happiness.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
text: The thing always happens that you really believe in; and the belief in thing makes it happen.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
text: One man cannot do right in one department of life whilst he is occupied in doing wrong in any other department. Life is one indivisible whole.

author: Anonymous
text: Do all the good you can, by all the means you can, in all the ways you can, in all the places you can, at all the times you can.

author: R.M. Lynch
text: If you have put your foot in your mouth, it is probably not the time to try to dance.

author: Alain AriasMisson
text: The purpose of art is not a rarified, intellectual distillate it is life, intensified, brilliant life.

author: George Herman 'Babe' Ruth
text: Never let the fear of striking out get in your way.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
text: Remember, we learn nothing by speaking.

author: Robert Orben
text: There's so much pollution in the air now that if it weren't for our lungs there'd be no place to put it all.

author: Les Brown
text: You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.

author: Dr. Jonas Salk
text: I have had dreams, and I have had nightmares. I overcame the nightmares because of my dreams.

author: J. Askenberg
text: You win some, you lose some, and some get rained out, but you gotta suit up for them all.

author: Stephen R. Covey
text: Any time you think the problem is out there, that very thought is the problem.

author: William Feather
text: Some of us might find happiness if we quit struggling so desperately for it.

author: Abraham Lincoln
text: Familiarize yourself with the chains of bondage and you prepare your own limbs to wear them. Accustomed to trample on the rights of others, you have lost the genius of your own independence and become the fit subjects of the first cunning tyrant who rises among you.

author: Hellen Keller
text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you can not see the shadows.

author: Democritus
text: It is better to correct your own faults than those of another.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: If you can't do great things, do small things in a great way. Don't wait for great opportunities. Seize common, everyday ones and make them great.

author: Unknown
text: If things are ever to move forward, someone must be willing to make the first step.

author: Doc Childre
text: Realize that now, in this moment of time, you are creating. You are creating your next moment based on what you are feeling and thinking. That is what's real.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: Do your work with your whole heart and you will succeed there's so little competition.

author: Rev. Randall R. McBride
text: Success will not lower its standard to us. We must raise our standard to success.

author: Jim Rohn
text: I find it fascinating that most people plan their vacations with better care than they plan their lives. Perhaps that is because escape is easier than change.

author: Barbara Bush
text: You don't just luck into things . . . You build step by step, whether it's friendships or opportunities.

author: Aesop
text: No act of kindness, however small, is ever wasted.

author: Ursula K. LeGuin
text: It is good to have an end to journey towards; but it is the journey that matters in the end.

author: A. C. Benson
text: It is often wonderful how putting down on paper a clear statement of a case helps one to see, not perhaps the way out, but the way in.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Theodore Roosevelt said Do what you can, with what you have, right where you are. This is great advice.

author: Unknown
text: The surest way to make yourself happy is to make someone else happy.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: It takes a habit to replace a habit.

author: Ken Blanchard
text: Catch people in the act of doing something right.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: Define your personal dignity today. Make a list of the positive internal qualities that you value that never change. Read it every morning and evening to remind yourself that no matter what you meet in the course of the day, regardless of the actions of others, no one can define who you are but you.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: If you want to reach a goal, you must 'see the reaching' in your own mind before you actually arrive at your goal.

author: William James
text: Let everything you do be done as if it makes a difference.

author: Mark Twain
text: I've had a lot of worries in my life, most of which never happened.

author: Helen Keller
text: The world is moved not only by the mighty shoves of the heroes, but also by the aggregate of the tiny pushes of each honest worker.

author: Brian Tracy
text: If you change your thinking, you change your life.

author: Victor Hugo
text: The smaller the heart, the bigger the hate it shelters.

author: W. Clement Stone
text: Be generous! Give to those you love; give to those who love you; give to the fortunate; give to the unfortunate yes, give especially to those you don't want to give. You will receive abundance for your giving. The more you give, the more you will have!

author: Hugh Downs
text: The price of freedom is responsibility, but it's a bargain, because freedom is priceless.

author: Leo Buscaglia
text: The easiest thing in the world to be is you. The most difficult thing to be is what other people want you to be. Don't let anyone put you in that position.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
text: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.

author: Brian Tracy
text: You have great, untapped reserves of potential within you. Your job is to release them.

author: Jack and Garry Kinder
text: High achievement always takes place in the framework of high expectation.

author: Honore De Balzac
text: To live in the presence of great truths and eternal laws, to be led by permanent ideals that is what keeps a man patient when the world ignores him, and calm and unspoiled when the world praises him.

author: Charles Darwin
text: It is not the strongest of the species that survive nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: When you live on a round planet, there's no choosing sides.

author: Syndey J. Harris
text: An idealist believes the short run doesn't count. A cynic believes the long run doesn't matter. A realist believes that what is done or left undone in the short run determines the long run.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: I discovered a long time ago that if I helped people get what they wanted, I would always get what I wanted and I would never have to worry.

author: Rumi
text: Be grateful for whoever comes, because each guest has been sent as a guide from beyond.

author: Elisabeth Kubler Ross
text: We have to accept the consequences of every deed, word and thought throughout our lifetime.

author: William Arthur Ward
text: The pessimist borrows trouble; the optimist lends encouragement.

author: Brian Tracy
text: When you are older, you realize that no one was ever thinking about you at all.

author: Katherine Graham
text: To love what you do and feel that it matters how could anything be more fun?

author: Mattie J.T. Stepanek
text: Every journey begins with but a small step and every day is a chance for a new, small step in the right direction. Just follow your Heart song.

author: Helen Keller
text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.

author: William Bennett
text: Happiness is like a cat. If you try to coax it or call it, it will avoid you. It will never come. But if you pay no attention to it and go about your business, you'll find it rubbing up against your legs and jumping into your lap.

author: Walt Disney
text: All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: What every child is looking for is to know, 'Do your eyes light up when I walk into the room?'

author: Jawaharlal Nehru
text: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.

author: Brian Tracy
text: The biggest mental roadblocks that you will ever have to overcome are those represented by your self-limiting beliefs.

author: John Wooden
text: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.

author: William James
text: The greatest discovery of my generation is that man can alter his life simply by altering his attitude of mind.

author: Louise L. Hay
text: There is plenty for everyone, including me.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
text: To be pleased with one's limits is a wretched state.

author: Jeanne Bice
text: What you resist persists and grows larger.

author: Duguet
text: The smallest good deed is better than the grandest good intention.

author: Unknown
text: Habits, if not resisted, soon become necessity.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Combine your mental images with the emotion of desire to accelerate their realization.

author: Louise L. Hay
text: When we create harmony in our minds and hearts we will find it in our lives. The inner creates the outer....always.

author: Katherine Mansfield
text: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy; you can't build on it; it's only for wallowing in.

author: Suzy Prudden
text: Your body is your vehicle for life. As long as you are here, live in it. Love, honor, respect and cherish it, treat it well and it will serve you in kind.

author: Henry Ford
text: There is no man living who isn't capable of doing more than he thinks he can do.

author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus
text: The happiness of your life depends on the quality of your thoughts.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Before I can walk in another person's shoes, I must first remove my own.

author: James Allen
text: People do not attract that which they want, but that which they are. (To put it another way: When you stop working on what it is you're trying to get and start working on YOU, only then will you get what it is you want.)

author: Bob Gass
text: Worry is like a rocking chair. It uses up all your energy, but where does it get you?

author: Richard Carlson
text: You will not suddenly develop wealth consciousness if and when you become 'wealthy'. It's the other way around. You develop wealth consciousness by eliminating worry, by trusting in the universe and in your own inner resources. Once you secure your wealth consciousness, true abundance is just around the corner.

author: Laugh Club Motto
text: Laugh until it helps!

author: Cherie CarterScott
text: Ordinary people believe in the possible. Extraordinary people visualize not what is possible or probable, but rather what is impossible and by visualizing the impossible, they begin to see it as possible.
Love all, serve all. Pocket logo on Hard Rock Cafe shirt

author: Henry C. Link
text: While one person hesitates because he feels inferior, the other is busy making mistakes and becoming superior.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: Our greatest happiness in life does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.

author: Karen Horney
text: Concern should drive us into action and not into a depression.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Be agreeable. It raises the self-esteem of others and makes you feel good about yourself.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could; some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in, forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day, begin it well and serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense.

author: John Wayne
text: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.

author: Dale Carnegie
text: Fear doesn't exist anywhere except in the mind.

author: Erma Bombeck
text: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: Power is not something that we can bestow on another person. It is something he or she already has within and will struggle to retain. Empowerment means that we acknowledge the personal power each person has to make positive decisions and to take responsibility for them, a simple exercise in treating others with dignity and respect.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Our choice of people to associate with, both personally and business wise, is one of the most important choices you make. If you associate with turkeys, you will never fly with the eagles.

author: Bill Cosby
text: I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is to try to please everyone.

author: Unknown
text: See miracles happening in your life; step into them as you see them in your mind's eye. See, feel, touch, smell, taste and breathe in your miracles.

author: Tom Hopkins
text: You are your greatest asset. Put your time, effort and money into training, grooming and encouraging your greatest asset.

author: Unknown
text: We cannot 'not' communicate. We do it by our presence and by our absence, by our silences as well as our words, by our choices, gestures and attitudes. We may not always do it well, but we always do it.

author: Robert H. Schuller
text: There are vast untapped resources of faith and talent that can only be discovered in adversity.

author: Sydney J. Harris
text: Maturity begins when we're content to feel we're right about something without feeling the necessity to prove someone else wrong.

author: Jack London
text: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
text: Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward; they may be beaten, but they may start a winning game.

author: Lao Tseu
text: Speaking with kindness creates confidence, thinking with kindness creates profoundness, giving with kindness creates love.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Decide today to design and build the ideal relationship in your life. It's up to you.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.

author: Stephen R. Covey
text: One of the best parts of being a family is that you can encourage one another. You can believe in one another. You can affirm one another.

author: Colin Powell
text: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.

author: Admiral Grace Hopper
text: The most damaging phrase in the language is, 'It's always been done that way'.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Superior people take both the credit and the blame for everything that happens to them.

author: George Bancroft
text: Beauty is but the sensible image of the Infinite. Like truth and justice it lives within us; like virtue and the moral law it is a companion of the soul.

author: Unknown
text: There is a choice you have to make, in everything you do. And you must always keep in mind the choice you make, makes you.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: View any and all obstacles as lessons, not indications of failure. Keep in mind that you are practicing patience and detachment from outcome. Everything that shows up in your life is supposed to; this includes the falls in your life, which provide you with the energy to propel yourself to a higher state of awareness.

author: Henri Bergson
text: Think like a man of action and act like a man of thought.

author: Marilyn Ferguson
text: Your past is not your potential. In any hour you can choose to liberate the future.

author: Unknown
text: The real art of conversation is not only to say the right thing at the right time, but also to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.

author: Plutarch
text: Know how to listen and you will profit even from those who talk badly.

author: Florence Scovel Shinn
text: Giving opens the way to receiving.

author: Mark Twain
text: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.

author: Susan Jeffers
text: We cannot escape fear. We can only transform it into a companion that accompanies us on all our exciting adventures. Take a risk a day one small or bold stroke that will make you feel great once you have done it.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Your true beliefs and values are only and always expressed in your actions, especially what you do under pressure.

author: Riner Maria Rilke
text: There is only one journey. Going inside yourself.

author: Annie Dillard
text: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
text: Mans mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions.

author: Ann Wang
text: Success is more a function of consistent common sense than it is of genius.

author: Unknown
text: Gratitude takes three forms: a feeling in the heart, an expression in words and giving in return.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: Whatever people do, they do for a reason and they think that it meets their needs....by THEIR perception.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Peace of mind is the highest human good and it is your normal, natural condition. Ask yourself, Do you want to be right, or do you want to be happy?

author: Jonathan Swift
text: Vision is the art of seeing the invisible.

author: Rita Davenport
text: What I think about, I bring about. The thought of success will foster success. The thought of love will foster love. The thought of security will foster security. What am I thinking about today?

author: John Wooden
text: If you get caught up in things over which you have no control, it will adversely affect those things over which you have control.

author: Ann McGee Cooper
text: Celebrate any progress. Don't wait to get perfect.

author: Parks Cousins
text: How things look on the outside of us depends on how things are on the inside of us.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.

author: Maria Shriver
text: Though you are no longer here, your spirit will always be alive in me.

author: Rick Warren
text: For God to use your painful experiences, you must be willing to share them.

author: Brian Tracy
text: You only have to succeed the last time.

author: Frank Tyger
text: Your future depends on many things, but mostly on you.

author: Pat A. Mitchell
text: Everyone needs and deserves love and happiness. Let's not wait until we're perfect to go out and find it.

author: Vince Lombardi
text: There is only one way to succeed in anything and that is to give it everything.

author: Harry Browne
text: You are where you are today because you've chosen to be there.

author: Greg Werner
text: Continuous excellent effort, not maximum strength or superior IQ, is the key to unlocking your potential as an achiever.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness, that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, and fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be?

author: Zig Ziglar
text: Your mind doesn't know the difference between reality and fantasy. Your mind acts on what you feed it. Feed it good thoughts.

author: George Bernard Shaw
text: People are always blaming their circumstances for what they are. I don't believe in circumstances. The people who get on in this world are the people who get up and look for the circumstances they want, and if they can't find them, make them.

author: Seigfried and Roy
text: The key to finding beauty is to know where to look.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: Spiritual beings do not allow their thoughts and feelings to flow from their actions, they understand that their thoughts create their physical world.

author: John Wanamaker
text: Do the next thing.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: Power moves with you when you have an intent to serve more than yourself.

author: Unknown
text: If you want to feel rich, just count all of the things you have that money can't buy.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Lucky people are simply those who think continually about what they want and then attract it into their lives.

author: Deepak Chopra
text: Miracles happen every day. They bubble up from their hidden source, surround us with opportunities and disappear.

author: Greg Werner
text: The only things in your control are your thoughts and then your actions. Positive, powerful thoughts lead to positive, powerful actions, and when done with repeated consistency this cycle leads to greatness. Dream it! Pray for it! Believe it! Work for it! And then be ready when it happens!

author: Mother Teresa
text: Let no one ever come to you without coming away better and happier.

author: Chinese Proverb
text: To know the road ahead, ask those coming back.

author: Erastus Wiman
text: Nothing is ever lost by courtesy. It is the cheapest of pleasures, costs nothing, and conveys much.

author: Doug Evelyn
text: Long-range planning works best in the short term.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: Once you become detached from 'things', they don't own you any longer.

author: Confucius
text: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Decisiveness is a common characteristic of all successful men and women.

author: John Maxwell
text: Leadership determines the direction of the company. Organization determines the potential of the company. Personnel determines the success of the company.

author: William James
text: Seek out that particular mental attribute which makes you feel most deeply and vitally alive, along with which comes the inner voice which says, 'This is the real me,' and then you have found that attitude, follow it.

author: Suze Orman
text: Each cent you apply toward diminishing your debt replenishes you.

author: Native American Prayer
text: Give thanks for unknown blessings already on their way.

author: Cummings
text: To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best, night and day, to make you somebody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight; and never stop fighting.

author: Marianne Williamson
text: In every moment, we teach either love or fear. As we demonstrate love towards others....we learn how to love more deeply.

author: Unknown
text: When one lives from love and gratitude, giving and kindness are the rewards.

author: Brian Tracy
text: You are surrounded by a universal mind that contains all the intelligence, ideas and knowledge that have ever existed.

author: Lewis Cass
text: Men may doubt what you say, but they will believe what you do.

author: Jim Bakker
text: What happens in your mind, happens in time.

author: Unknown
text: When you are inspired by some great purpose, some extraordinary project, all your thoughts break their bounds. Dormant forces, faculties and talents become alive, and you discover yourself to be a greater person by far than you ever dreamed yourself to be.

author: Anais Nin
text: Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive and it is only by this meeting that this new world is born.

author: Brian Dyson
text: Don't undermine your worth by comparing yourself with others. It is because we are different that each of us is special.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
text: The mind is the limit. As long as the mind can envision the fact that you can do something, you can do it, as long as you really believe a 100 percent.

author: John Neal
text: A certain amount of opposition is a great help to a man. Kites rise against, not with the wind.

author: Brian Tracy
text: Any good that you can do, do it now. Do not delay it or forestall it, for you will not pass this way again.

author: Thomas Fuller
text: He that cannot forgive others breaks the bridge over which he must pass himself; for every man has need to be forgiven.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: The more you recognize and express gratitude for the things you have, the more you will have to express gratitude for.

author: Osborn Alex
text: Creative ideas reside in people's minds but are trapped by fear or rejection. Create a judgment free environment and you'll unleash a torrent of creativity.

author: Orison Swett Marden
text: If you do not feel yourself growing in your work and your life broadening and deepening, if your task is not a perpetual tonic to you, you have not found your place.

author: Maya Angelou
text: Children's talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: Saving money is a worthwhile goal, but by itself it won't bring you economic abundance. The third key to mastering your finances is to increase your wealth. To accomplish this, you must spend less than you earn, invest the difference, and reinvest your returns for compounded growth. Compounding puts your money to work for you by increasing it exponentially. The pace at which you achieve financial independence is in direct proportion to your willingness to reinvest not spend the profits of your past investments.

author: Oriental Proverb
text: Pearls do not lie on the seashore. If you desire one, you must dive for it.

author: Kahlil Gibran
text: I wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: As a society, we have come to a point where people too often treat one another as objects and opportunities, rather than as fellow human beings. Respecting one another as individuals, or not doing so, seriously impacts the future for all of us.

author: General Norman Schwarzkopf
text: To be a great leader... remember, when placed in command TAKE CHARGE!

author: Vince Lombardi
text: There's no such thing as Perfection. But, in striving for perfection, we can achieve excellence

author: Socrates
text: Let him that would move the world, first move himself.

author: Denis Waitley
text: It's not what you are that holds you back, it's what you think you are not.

author: Proverb
text: Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings while the dawn is still dark.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: Trust yourself. Have confidence that you can draw the best, not the worst, to yourself.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: Life is a gift and all of us who have the capacity must remember that we have the responsibility to give something back; a small but consistent commitment of time and caring can make a measurable difference in the world.

author: Oral Roberts
text: Expect a miracle!

author: Anais Nin
text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.

author: John Ruskin
text: In every person who comes near you look for what is good and strong; honor that; try to imitate it, and your faults will drop off like dead leaves when their time comes.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal: Nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: Life's lessons may be viewed as difficulties or challenges to be overcome, but in reality they are an exercise in fine tuning that will make our efforts more effective in the long run. We are developing skills, attitudes, and perspectives that we need to move forward with insight and awareness.

author: Charles M. Schwab
text: A man to carry on a successful business must have imagination. He must see things as in a vision, a dream of the whole thing.

author: Katherine Dunham
text: In knowing how to overcome little things, a centimeter at a time, gradually when bigger things come, you're prepared.

author: Margery Williams
text: Once you are "real" you can't become unreal again. It lasts for always.

author: Suze Orman
text: Abundance is about being rich with or without money

author: Unknown
text: Winners are ordinary people with extraordinary determination.

author: Harriet Woods
text: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.

author: John D. Rockefeller III
text: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles: find what it is that interests you and that you can do well and when you find it, put your whole soul into it....every bit of energy, ambition and natural ability you have.

author: Whoopi Goldberg
text: When you are kind to someone, you hope they'll remember and be kind to someone else and it will become like wildfire.

author: Peter Drucker
text: No institution can possibly survive if it needs geniuses or supermen to manage it. It must be organized in such a way as to be able to get along under a leadership composed of average human beings.

author: Mark Twain
text: Keep away from small people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.

author: Phillips Brooks
text: The truest help we can render an afflicted man is not to take his burden from him, but to call out his best energy, that he may be able to bear the burden.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
text: One of the annoying things about believing in free will and individual responsibility is the difficulty of finding somebody to blame your problems on. And when you do find somebody, it's remarkable how often his picture turns up on your driver's license.

author: Unknown
text: No dream is out of reach....you can do anything!

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: You must do the thing you think you cannot do.

author: Donny Osmond
text: If you're climbing the ladder of life, you go rung by rung, one step at a time.sometimes you don't think you're progressing until you step back and see how high you've really gone.

author: Daniel Webster
text: There is always room at the top.

author: Walter Annenberg
text: I want to remind you that success in life is based on hard slogging. There will be periods when discouragement is great and upsetting, and the antidote for this is calmness and fortitude and a modest yet firm belief in your competence. Be sure that your priorities are in order so that you can proceed in a logical manner, and be ever mindful that nothing will take the place of persistence.

author: Italian Proverb
text: Do good and care not to whom.

author: Glen Seaborg
text: I believe that one of the characteristics of the human race, possibly the one that is primarily responsible for its course of evolution, is that it has grown by creatively responding to failure.

author: Charles Dickens
text: Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has many not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.

author: Sydney Smith
text: Whatever you are by nature, keep to it; never desert your line of talent. Be what nature intended you for and you will succeed.

author: Orison Swett Marden
text: Wisdom is knowledge which has become a part of one's being...

author: Anthony Robbins
text: Always remember that you are bigger than the moment, you are more than anything that could ever happen to you.

author: Henry Fielding
text: Adversity is the trial of principle. Without it, a man hardly knows whether he is honest or not.

author: Mary Manin Morrissey
text: One way we can know that we are aligned with the life force that is God is that we feel more and more alive. Notice what gives you aliveness and what diminishes you, deadens and numbs you so that you only skim the surface of life. Begin to say YES to what quickens and energizes, to that which brings joy and gratitude.

author: Unknown
text: The way you are is not the result of what has happened to you, it's the result of what you decide to keep inside you.

author: Katharine Butler Hathaway
text: If you let your fear of consequence prevent you from following your deepest instinct, your life will be safe, expedient and thin.

author: M. Scott Peck
text: Often the most loving thing we can do when a friend is in pain is to share the pain to be there even when we have nothing to offer except our presence and even when being there is painful to ourselves.

author: Maxwell Maltz
text: You must have courage to bet on your ideals, to take calculated risk, and act.. Everyday living requires courage if life is to be effective and bring happiness.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
text: I dream my painting and then paint my dream.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr
text: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.

author: Billy Graham
text: A keen sense of humor helps us to overlook the unbecoming, understand the unconventional, tolerate the unpleasant, overcome the unexpected and outlast the unbearable.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: You only lose energy when life becomes dull in your mind. Your mind gets bored and therefore tired of doing nothing. Get interested in something! Get absolutely enthralled with something! Get out of yourself! Be somebody! Do something! The more you lose yourself in something bigger than yourself, the more energy you will have.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
text: The best way to know God is to love many things.

author: G. Weatherly
text: Forgiving those who hurt us is the key to personal peace.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.

author: Phillips Brooks
text: Character may be manifested in the great moments, but it is made in the small ones.

author: Greg Werner
text: The life of a high achiever is one of risk and reward, one of sowing and reeping, and/or one of straining and growing. Nothing great will happen unless you first take a risk, sow the right seed, and/or strain through resistance. Get started and make your dreams come true.

author: Zenrin
text: If you wish to know the road up the mountain, ask the man who goes back and forth on it.

author: Linda Bloodworth-Thomason
text: Figure out what your most magnificent qualities are and make them indispensable to the people you want to work with. Notice that I didn't say "work force.â€

author: Albert Einstein
text: Out of clutter, find simplicity.

author: John Ruskin
text: The highest reward for a person's toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.

author: Nancy Thayer
text: It's never too late, in fiction or in life, to revise.

author: Booker T. Washington
text: The world cares very little about what a man or woman knows; it is what the man or woman is able to do that counts.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: All people want and have the right to be treated with Dignity and Respect, No Exceptions. The only way we can do this is by separating people from their behavior. Behavior is not always worthy of respect, but the person always is.

author: Unknown
text: When you don't talk, you hear yourself better.

author: Thomas A. Edison
text: I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.

author: Leo Buscaglia
text: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring....all of which have the potential to turn a life around.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
text: The gratification of wealth is not found in mere possession or in lavish expenditure, but in its wise application.

author: Unknown
text: A healthy attitude is contagious but don't wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.

author: Maya Angelou
text: I did the best I could at the time and when I knew better, I did better.

author: Chelle Thompson
text: There have been so many times in my life when things that looked like disasters were really incredible GIFTS that served as pivotal turning points. I am truly thankful for perserving through all of my "mistakes".

author: Harrison Ford
text: All I would tell people is to hold onto what was individual about themselves, not to allow their ambition for success to cause them to try to imitate the success of others. You've got to find it on your own terms.

author: Jacob A. Riis
text: Some defeats are only installments to victory.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
text: In any moment of decision the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst thing you can do is nothing. After all, if we do the wrong thing, at least we can learn.

author: Malcolm Forbes
text: IF YOU CAN DO don't not.

author: Brian Tracy
text: If you don't set goals for yourself, you are doomed to work to achieve the goals of someone else.

author: Unknown
text: If we command our wealth, we shall be rich and free; if our wealth commands us, we are poor indeed.

author: Harvey S. Firestone
text: It is only as we develop others that we permanently succeed.

author: Denis De Rougamont
text: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: Kindness is something that we must own and extend to ourselves, before we are able to extend it to others. When we do this, we do not determine whether someone deserves our kindness anymore than we determine whether someone deserves to be spoken to in their own language. It is simply something we do because it has become our nature to be kind.

author: Albert Schweitzer
text: Man must cease attributing his problems to his environment and learn to exercise his will his personal responsibility.

author: John Lyons
text: Look at frustration as a positive thing. It is the frustration that drives you to improve.

author: Pearl S. Buck
text: To serve is beautiful, but only if it is done with joy and a whole heart and a free mind.

author: W. Clement Stone
text: You, too, can determine what you want. You can decide on your major objectives, targets, aims, and destination.

author: Unknown
text: There are many ways to measure success; not the least of which is the way your child describes you when talking to a friend.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
text: Time ripens all things; no man is born wise.

author: Jackson Brown
text: Opportunity dances with those who are already on the dance floor.

author: Les Brown
text: The only limits to the possibilities in your life tomorrow are your "buts" you use today.

author: Philp McGraw
text: You are not the only influence in your children's life....that is why you MUST BE the BEST INFLUENCE in your children's life!

author: Native American Proverb
text: As you go the way of life you will see a great chasm. Jump. It is not as wide as you think.

author: Thomas Fuller
text: All things are difficult before they are easy.

author: Geoffry F. Abert
text: The most important thing about goals is having one.

author: Charles B. Newcomb
text: Let us move on, and step out boldly, though it be into the night and we can scarcely see the way.

author: Unknown
text: Know that every "no" is one step closer to a "YES"! Never give up!

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much can be done if we are always doing.

author: Elizabeth Harrison
text: Those who are lifting the world upward and onward are those who encourage more than criticize.

author: Elizabeth KÃ¼bler Ross
text: People are like stained glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.

author: Bob Goddard
text: Just remember....when you think all is lost, the future remains.

author: Aldous Huxley
text: Experience is not what happens to a man; it is what a man does with what happens to him.

author: Mohandas Gandhi
text: Let us become the change we seek in this world.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.

author: Og Mandino
text: The victory of success is half won when one gains the habit of setting goals and achieving them. Even the most tedious chore will become endurable as you parade through each day convinced that every task, no matter how menial or boring, brings you closer to fulfilling your dreams.

author: Charles F. Kettering
text: It is the 'follow through' that makes the great difference between ultimate success and failure, because it is so easy to stop.

author: Jim Rohn
text: Learn how to be happy with what you have while you pursue all that you want.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
text: Originality and the feeling of one's own dignity are achieved only through work and struggle.

author: Pablo Picasso
text: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.

author: Eric Hoffer
text: We are more ready to try the untried when what we do is inconsequential. Hence, the remarkable fact that many inventions had their birth as toys.

author: Ben Sweetland
text: Success is a journey, not a destination.

author: George Eliot
text: Decide on what you think is right, and stick to it.

author: Grocho Marx
text: I find television very educational. Every time someone switches it on I go into another room and read a good book.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: What the mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.

author: Unknown
text: A friend is one who comes to you when all others leave.

author: Stephen R. Covey
text: Live out of your imagination, not your history.

author: Douglas Bloch
text: As you begin to live in the present moment, you will experience a subtle but profound change. Worrying about the future will cease. A deep peace will enfold you, a peace that says, "All is well". There is nothing to fear. Everything is unfolding according to plan and you are being guided each step along the way.

author: Marianne Williamson
text: Everything we do is infused with the energy with which we do it. If we're frantic, life will be frantic. If we're peaceful, life will be peaceful. And so our goal in any situation becomes inner peace. Our internal state determines our experience of our lives; our experiences do not determine our internal state.

author: Wayne Dyer
text: Wisdom is avoiding all thoughts that weaken you.

author: Unknown
text: Life is an adventure to be lived, not a problem to be solved.

author: Master Sergeant Emil W. Zacharia
text: You don't need anybody's permission to be a good leader. All you have to do is be a resource to the team; know your people; look out after their welfare; keep them informed and let them take part in the decisions which affect them. Do this and the team and you will succeed.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
text: Become a "possibilitarian". No matter how dark thing seem to be or actually are, raise your sights and see the possibilities, always see them for they are always there.

author: Ashleigh Brilliant
text: Everything you lose gives you a little more space for something new.

author: Suze Orman
text: Be aware of the language of poverty as it's spoken around you; "I don't care about money; I don't understand it; I'll never get out of debt." This is the language that will keep you poor. Instead, affirm the positive: "I am financially secure. I create abundance. I have everything I want and need."

author: Johann Wolfgangvon
text: He, who moves not forward, goes backward.

author: Shelley Long
text: If you don't quit, and don't cheat, and don't run home when trouble arrives, you can only win.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: Do your work with your whole heart and you will succeed here's so little competition.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: Let your light shine. Shine within you so that it can shine on someone else. Let your light shine.

author: Gail Pursell Elliott
text: We create our own destiny with our choices and decisions. We can base these decisions upon the awareness of our inner truth or we can base them on reactions to outer circumstances. This power always belongs to us. No one can take it from us.

author: Stephen Covey
text: Seek First to understand, then to be understood.

author: Unknown
text: Enjoy and laugh a lot. Up or down, love the ride.

author: Jany Wyman
text: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.

author: Brian Tracy
text: The ability to discipline yourself to delay gratification in the short term in order to enjoy greater rewards in the long term is the indispensable prerequisite for success.

author: Anthony Robbins
text: If you develop the absolute sense of certainty that powerful beliefs prove, then you can get yourself to accomplish virtually anything, including those things that other people are certain are impossible.

author: William Feather
text: Some people are making such thorough preparation for rainy days that they aren't enjoying today's sunshine.

author: Carlos Castenada
text: We either make ourselves miserable or we make ourselves strong. The amount of effort is the same.

author: Dr. Wayne W. Dyer
text: The state of your life is nothing more than a reflection of your state of mind.

author: Stephen R. Covey
text: To judge individuals before understanding them is a form of human rejection and feeds upon itself.

author: Leo Buscaglia
text: There are two big forces at work, external and internal. We have very little control over external forces such as tornados, earthquakes, floods, disasters, illness and pain. What really matters is internal force. How do I respond to those disasters? Over that I have complete control.

author: Unknown
text: Never miss an opportunity to make someone smile.

author: Og Mandino
text: Never again clutter your days or nights with so many menial and unimportant things that you have no time to accept a real challenge when it comes along. This applies to play as well as work. A day merely survived is no cause for celebration. You are not here to fritter away your precious hours when you have the ability to accomplish so much by making a slight change in your routine. No more busy work. No more hiding from success. Leave time, leave space, to grow. Now. Now! Not tomorrow!

author: Thomas Dreier
text: The world is a great mirror. It reflects back to you what you are. If you are loving, if you are friendly, if you are helpful, the world will prove loving and friendly and helpful to you. The world is what you are.

author: Niccolo Machiavelli
text: Make no small plans for they have not the power to stir men's blood.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
text: As every divided kingdom falls, so every mind divided between many studies confounds and saps itself.

author: Arland Gilbert
text: When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm, miracles can happen.

author: Greg Werner
text: Make progress one time and it makes you happy. Make progress day after day, week after week and it makes you a champion.

author: Arthur Warwick
text: I had rather do and not promise than promise and not do.

author: Jim Rohn
text: If you go to work on your goals, your goals will go to work on you. If you go to work on your plan, your plan will go to work on you. Whatever good things we build end up building us.

author: Marcia Wieder
text: It is essential to our wellbeing, and to our lives, that we play and enjoy life. Every single day do something that makes your heart sing.

author: Mother Teresa
text: Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.

author: William Hazlitt
text: I like a person who knows his own mind and sticks to it; who sees at once what, in given circumstances, is to be done, and does it.

author: Lao Tzu
text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.

author: Henry James
text: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your BELIEF will help create the fact.

author: Lee Iacocca
text: The discipline of writing something down is the first step toward making it happen.

author: Lloyd Jones
text: The men who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try to do nothing and succeed.

author: Dr. Michael Norwood
text: Vision doesn't usually come as a lightening bolt. Rather it comes as a slow crystallization of life challenges that we one day recognize as a beautiful diamond with great value to ourselves and others.

author: Thomas Carlyle
text: Do not be embarrassed by your mistakes. Nothing can teach us better than our understanding of them. This is one of the best ways of self-education.

author: John Travolta
text: You feel alive to the degree that you can help.

author: William Wordsworth
text: The best portion of a good man's life is in his little nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.

author: Harold Nye
text: If you are not generous with a meager income, you will never be generous with abundance.

author: Unknown
text: Some people, no matter how old they get, never lose their beauty....they merely move it from their faces into their hearts.

author: Charles Connolly
text: Questions focus our thinking. Ask empowering questions like What's good about this? What's not perfect about it yet? What am I going to do next time? How can I do this and have fun doing it?

author: William James
text: A great many people think they are thinking when they are rearranging their prejudices.

author: William Henry Channing
text: To live content with small means; to seek elegance rather than luxury, and refinement rather than fashion; to be worthy, not respectable, and wealthy, not rich; to study hard, think quietly, talk gently, act frankly; to listen to stars and birds, to babes and sages, with open heart; to bear all cheerfully, do all bravely, await occasions, hurry never. In a word, to let the spiritual, unbidden and unconscious, grow up through the common. This is to be my symphony.

author: Richard Mitchell
text: There is no other way to judge the work of a mind except through its words.

author: Ron Gornto
text: You can't lead by memo. Leadership is a contact sport, eyeball to eyeball, on the field with the sound of the contest in your ears. Most everything else is noise from the grandstand.

author: Samuel Johnson
text: Few enterprises of great labor or hazard would be undertaken if we had not the power of magnifying the advantages we expect from them.

author: Claude M. Bristol
text: It's the repetition of affirmations that leads to belief. And once that belief becomes a deep conviction, things begin to happen.

author: Grace Lichtenstein
text: Your opponent, in the end, is never really the player on the other side of the net, or the swimmer in the next lane, or the team on the other side of the field, or even the bar you must high jump. Your opponent is yourself, your negative internal voices, your level of determination.

author: Eric Hoffer
text: The rule seems to be that those who find no difficulty in deceiving themselves are easily deceived by others. They are easily persuaded and led.

author: Thomas Fuller
text: Zeal without knowledge is fire without light.

author: Titus Maccius Plautus
text: Where there are friends there is wealth.

author: Thomas Kempis
text: The acknowledgment of our weakness is the first step in repairing our loss.

author: Orison Swett Marden
text: The waste of life occasioned by trying to do too many things at once is appalling.

author: W. Somerset Maugham
text: The common idea that success spoils people by making them vain, egotistic, and self-complacent is erroneous; on the contrary, it makes them, for the most part, humble, tolerant, and kind. Failure makes people bitter and cruel.

author: George Gilder
text: Capitalists are motivated not chiefly by the desire to consume wealth or indulge their appetites, but by the freedom and power to consummate their entrepreneurial ideas.

author: Francis Bacon
text: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is.

author: Ayn Rand
text: Throughout the centuries, there were men who took first steps, down new roads, armed with nothing but their own vision.

author: Buddha
text: Be vigilant; guard your mind against negative thoughts.

author: Jim Rohn
text: We get paid for bringing value to the market place.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: Is the oak better than the acorn which is its fullness and completion?

author: Edward De Bono
text: Unhappiness is best defined as the difference between our talents and our expectations.

author: John Locke
text: The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our increase of knowledge; secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
text: Uncertainty is the refuge of hope.

author: Albert Einstein
text: When I examine myself and my methods of thought, I come to the conclusion that the gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.

author: Alexis Carrel
text: A few observations and much reasoning lead to error; many observations and a little reasoning to truth.

author: Hosea Ballou
text: Theories are always very thin and insubstantial, experience only is tangible.

author: Erica Jong
text: Everyone has talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.

author: W. Clement Stone
text: Sales are contingent upon the attitude of the salesman not the attitude of the prospect.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
text: It is a clear gain to sacrifice pleasure in order to avoid pain.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
text: We are never more discontented with others than when we are discontented with ourselves.

author: George Santayana
text: All living souls welcome whatever they are ready to cope with; all else they ignore, or pronounce to be monstrous and wrong, or deny to be possible.

author: Will Rogers
text: Why not go out on a limb ... that is where the fruit is.

author: Roger Bacon
text: There are in fact four very significant stumbling blocks in the way of grasping the truth, which hinder every man however learned, and scarcely allow anyone to win a clear title to wisdom, namely, the example of weak and unworthy authority, longstanding custom, the feeling of the ignorant crowd, and the hiding of our own ignorance while making a display of our apparent knowledge.

author: Brian Goldman
text: Good doctors exercise judgment. They make the call and – right or wrong – live with the consequences and learn from them. The redefined M.D. is flawed, but comfortable inside their own skin.

author: Ovid
text: Time is generally the best doctor.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Isaac Newton
text: If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.

author: Mark Twain
text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

author: Carl Jung
text: Medicines cure diseases, but only doctors can cure patients.

author: C. Everett Koop
text: Drugs don’t work in patients who don’t take them.

author: William Osler
text: One of the first duties of the physician is to educate the masses not to take medicine… Soap and water and common sense are the best disinfectants.

author: Charlotte Gerson
text: It’s the doctors duty to activate and reactivate the body’s own healing mechanism.

author: Paul Farmer
text: The idea that some lives matter less is the root of all that is wrong in the world.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
text: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.

author: Sir William Osler
text: Let me congratulate you on the choice of calling which offers a combination of intellectual and moral interests found in no other profession.

author: Hippocrates
text: The life so short, the craft so long to learn.

author: Enid Bagnold
text: When a man goes through six years training to be a doctor he will never be the same. He knows too much.

author: Roy Blount, Jr.
text: Doctors and lawyers must go to school for years and years, often with little sleep and with great sacrifice to their first wives.

author: Richard Asher
text: For many doctors the achievement of a published article is a tedious duty to be surmounted as a necessary hurdle in a medical career.

author: Justin Chambers
text: I would not be able to retain all the information, all the medical jargon these doctors do. I’m not really intelligent enough is what I’m saying.

author: Martin H. Fischer
text: Our profession is the only one which works unceasingly to annihilate itself.

author: Martin H. Fischer
text: Observation, Reason, Human Understanding, Courage; these make the physician.

author: Hippocrates
text: Wherever the art of Medicine is loved, there is also a love of Humanity.

author: Cicero
text: In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men.

author: William Osler
text: There are only two sorts of doctors: those who practice with their brains, and those who practice with their tongues.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: The best doctor gives the least medicines.

author: Peter Rogers
text: Why are infectious disease doctors the best ones to date? They are the most cultured and sensitive.

author: Edward E. Rosenbaum
text: There is no such thing as an infallible doctor.

author: Denis Diderot
text: The best doctor is the one you run to and can’t find.

author: Sun Simiao
text: Medicine is intention. Those who are proficient at using intention are good doctors.

author: William Osler
text: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.

author: Karl Marx
text: Medicines heal doubts as well as diseases.

author: Andrew Saul
text: Medicine is aptly described as an art, not a science. To this end, four different doctors may have up to four different diagnoses or prescriptions.

author: William J. Mayo
text: The aim of medicine is to prevent disease and prolong life; the ideal of medicine is to eliminate the need of a physician.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
text: No families take so little medicine as those of doctors, except those of apothecaries.

author: Paracelsus
text: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore, the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.

author: Vince Flynn
text: My doctors warned me repeatedly that if you don't stay positive, you don't do well.

author: Proverbs
text: A merry heart is a good medicine; but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

author: Curt Schilling
text: It is all about rehab. Most doctors can make you 100 percent well physically. I would tell you that it is 25 percent about the surgery and 75 percent about the rehab.

author: C. Jeff Miller
text: Body and soul cannot be separated for purposes of treatment, for they are one and indivisible. Sick minds must be healed as well as sick bodies.

author: Dr. Morgan Martin
text: The physician treats with words; within the physician-patient social system, the patient is moved by fears and other sentiments, and these are modified by the physician’s words and phrases. Physicians dispense not only medicines but words that influence medicines or, all by themselves, that affect the patient more than the medicine.

author: Norman Cousins
text: Each patient carries his own doctor inside him.

author: Giorgio Baglivi
text: Let the young know they will never find a more interesting, more instructive book than the patient himself.

author: Dr. Amir Qaseem
text: Physicians and patients need to work together to pursue care that improves health, avoids harms and eliminates wasteful practices.

author: Earl Campbell
text: There are two things panic patients hate to do. They hate to take medication – and they hate to go to doctors. They hate to come to grips.

author: William S. Burroughs
text: You need a good bedside manner with doctors or you will get nowhere.

author: Ayn Rand
text: Doctors are not servants of their patients, they are traders like everyone else in a free society and they should bear that title proudly considering the crucial importance of the services they offer.

author: Seneca
text: People pay the doctor for his trouble; for his kindness they still remain in his debt.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
text: My doctor is nice; every time I see him, I’m ashamed of what I think of doctors in general.

author: Nancy Grace
text: I really like my doctors. Some of them I love. I trust them.

author: Natalie Cole
text: I'm just really, really thankful. I'm thankful to the doctors; I'm thankful to the family that donated the kidney.

author: Walt Whitman
text: I love doctors and hate their medicine.

author: Claire Wineland
text: I’m grateful for the doctors that’ll be scooping out these lungs and giving me some more life to work with. I’m grateful for the chance to keep being a person.

author: Anna Deavere Smith
text: I am lucky: I have fantastic doctors and a fantastic dentist.

author: R. J. Palacio
text: I actually like how doctors talk. I like the sound of science. I like how words you don’t understand explain things you can’t understand.

author: Larry Hagman
text: A lot of times I talk to people, they say they don’t trust the doctors, they don’t trust the hospitals and that kind of stuff. Well, if you go to the hospital, you’ve got to trust somebody.

author: Erma Bombeck
text: Many people are intimidated by doctors. People also feel stupid when they don’t understand what a doctor’s talking about the first time around, so they don’t ask again. And let’s be honest here, people. English is not a doctor’s first language.

author: Mary Stuart Masterson
text: In this case they’re doctors. But having passion for your work and to take risks in order to better humankind. That’s a pretty big theme. It’s pretty inspiring.

author: Erich Fromm
text: One cannot be deeply responsive to the world without being saddened very often.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
text: Doctors will have more lives to answer for in the next world than even we generals.

author: Alexander of Tralles
text: The physician should ometimes, the best thing we can do fook upon the patient as a besieged city and try to rescue him with every means that art and science place at his command.

author: Edward Young
text: Affliction is a good man’s shining time.

author: George Bernard Shaw
text: The most tragic thing in the world is a sick doctor.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: There’s never been a doctor who served many patients who, despite their best efforts, did not lose some of them to death. But they understood that was part of life itself.

author: Elizabeth Warren
text: Disease, sickness, and old age touch every family. Tragedy doesn’t ask who you voted for. Health care is a basic human right.

author: Atul Gawande
text: No matter what measures are taken, doctors will sometimes falter, and it isn’t reasonable to ask that we achieve perfection. What is reasonable is to ask that we never cease to aim for it.

author: Katy Butler
text: I’ve heard doctors say that before the crisis hits, people don’t want prolonged measures, but then in the middle of the crisis they want everything.

author: Jane Wilson-Howarth
text: GPs are almost the only doctors these days who understand all problems, can see the whole person… spend time with the dying… see things through to the end.

author: Richard Dawkins
text: Compassionate doctors sometimes lie to patients about the severity of their condition, and it is not always wrong to do so.

author: Marian Wright Edelman
text: You really can change the world if you care enough.

author: Edward Albert
text: The simple act of caring is heroic.

author: Lao Tzu
text: From caring comes courage.

author: Bernie Siegel
text: I wish medical schools helped us to analyze our healthy and unhealthy reasons for becoming doctors.

author: Alexandra Fuller
text: There aren’t enough doctors in Africa. Those who choose to become doctors here don’t do it for the money or because they want to do good. They do it because they have to heal, the way most people need to breathe or eat or love.

author: Michael Greger
text: For many children, it’s seeing a beloved relative ill and in pain that leads them to want to become doctors. But, for me, it was watching my grandma get better.

author: Pablo Picasso
text: Two of the most frustrated trades are dentists and photographers – dentists because they want to be doctors, and photographers because they want to be painters.

author: Kumail Nanjiani
text: I’m from a family of doctors, and I think they really wanted me to be a doctor. I even sort of assumed I would be a doctor.

author: Jeremy Irons
text: I envy children who know that they’re going to become doctors, know they’re going to go into the forces or whatever. I think choice is one of the hardest things, but that’s what I try to give my children, to say you can do anything.

author: Zoe Saldana
text: Growing up, my dolls were doctors and on secret missions. I had Barbie Goes Rambo.

author: Tim Howard
text: I try and tell all the kids that I meet that hope to be amazing one day and be a professional athlete or a doctor or a lawyer or whatever they want to be. I tell them they can do all that because Tourette’s won’t stop them.

author: Olivier Theyskens
text: When other boys dreamt of going to the moon or becoming doctors, I wanted to be a designer.

author: Denise Morrison
text: I am one of four girls and was inspired by my father to dream big. Some girls want to be doctors, but I wanted to run a company.

author: Tess Gerritsen
text: My father said writing was a nice hobby. He strongly encouraged my brother and me to become doctors.

author: Dorothy Fields
text: There aren’t more lady songwriters for the same reason that there aren’t more lady doctors or lady accountants or lady lawyers; not enough women have the time for careers.

author: James H. Boren
text: I got the bill for my surgery. Now I know what those doctors were wearing masks for.

author: Earl Wilson
text: You may not be able to read a doctor’s handwriting and prescription, but you’ll notice his bills are neatly typewritten.

author: Evan Esar
text: The man who doctors himself with the aid of medical books, runs the risk of dying of a typographical error.

author: Edward Everett Hale
text: In the name of Hypocrites, doctors have invented the most exquisite form of torture ever known to man: survival.

author: Joe Haldeman
text: Doctors don’t seem to realize that most of us are perfectly content not having to visualize ourselves as animated bags of skin filled with obscene glop.

author: Jonathan Swift
text: The best doctors in the world are Doctor Diet, Doctor Quiet, and Doctor Merryman.

author: Al McGuire
text: Remember, half the doctors in this country graduated in the bottom half of their class.

author: Jay Leno
text: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that 9 out of 10 doctors agree that 1 out of 10 doctors is an idiot.

author: Jerry Seinfeld
text: Women go after doctors like men go after models. They want someone with knowledge of the body. We just want the body.

author: George Carlin
text: Isn’t it a bit unnerving that doctors call what they do ‘practice’?

author: Michael Moore
text: Healthcare should be between the doctor and the patient. And if the doctor says something needs to be done, the government should guarantee it gets paid for.

author: Jose Andres
text: When we are trying to come up with new health laws, you bring doctors, you bring experts in medicine. In urban planning, you bring the best architects. How it is possible that when we are talking about the way we are going to feed America, no chef shows up in the room?

author: Al Gore
text: Americans have the right to have their medical decisions made by them and their doctors, and not by those bureaucrats sitting behind a computer screen hundreds of miles away.

author: Mike Ferguson
text: America’s doctors, nurses and medical researchers are the best in the world, but our health care system is broken.

author: Timothy Murphy
text: The best doctors and the best hospitals in America, if they cannot get the patient information they need when they need it, it can lead to morbid consequences: Higher mortality.

author: Barbara Boxer
text: We have the greatest hospitals, doctors, and medical technology in the world – we need to make them accessible to every American.

author: Charles Krauthammer
text: Now this is a way to approach our healthcare problems: increase the number of tax collectors and decrease the number of doctors – brilliant!

author: Peter Diamandis
text: By 2020 the U.S. will be short 91,000 doctors. There’s no way we can educate enough doctors to make up that shortfall, and other countries are far worse off.

author: Mehmet Oz
text: True health care reform cannot happen in Washington. It has to happen in our kitchens, in our homes, in our communities. All health care is personal.

author: Bernie Sanders
text: The goal of real healthcare reform must be high-quality, universal coverage in a cost-effective way.

author: Dennis Kucinich
text: Everyone should have health insurance? I say everyone should have health care. I’m not selling insurance.

author: Leo Varadkar
text: I’ve realised that doctors can only help change a certain number of patients, but a Minister of Health can really change things.

author: Thomas Sowell
text: It is amazing that people who think we cannot afford to pay for doctors, hospitals, and medication somehow think that we can afford to pay for doctors, hospitals, medication and a government bureaucracy to administer it.

author: Barack Obama
text: In the wealthiest nation on Earth, no one should go broke just because they get sick.

author: Margaret Chan
text: The World Health Organization did a world health report in 2006. In the whole world about 60 countries are in dire situation in terms of having enough doctors. And many of these countries are in Sub-Saharan Africa. You know, that part of the world alone needs one million doctors.

author: Mark Zuckerberg
text: AI systems will enable doctors to diagnose diseases and treat people better, so blocking that progress is probably one of the worst things you can do for making the world better.

author: Bill Gates
text: Technology must be implemented as part of a thoughtful, holistic approach to education transformation that includes teacher training, relevant curricula, parental involvement, and programs for children that fill unmet needs for basics like nutrition and health care.

author: Lewis Thomas
text: Doctors, dressed up in one professional costume or another, have been in busy practice since the earliest records of every culture on earth. It is hard to think of a more dependable or enduring occupation, harder still to imagine any future events leading to its extinction.

author: Martin H. Fischer
text: A doctor must work eighteen hours a day and seven days a week. If you cannot console yourself to this, get out of the profession.

author: David Ogilvy
text: Great hospitals do two things. They look after patients, and they teach young doctors.

author: Richard Diaz
text: Most doctors are prisoners of their education and shackled by their profession.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
text: He is the best physician who is the most ingenious inspirer of hope.

author: Edward E. Rosenbaum
text: There is no such thing as an infallible doctor.

author: Magic Johnson
text: The best doctors and medicine in the world can’t save you if you don’t do what you’re supposed to do.

author: Voltaire
text: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.

author: John Harvey Kellogg
text: Disease is cured by the body itself, not by doctors or remedies.

author: Atul Gawande
text: Culture matters. Of course, if physicians are rewarded or penalized for their service and results, the culture will change. But the key values we doctors are being pressed to embrace are humility, teamwork, and discipline.

author: Neal Barnard
text: I think we have to do everything that’s useful. We’re doctors. Our job is to tell the truth. And it doesn’t have to be embellished in any way.

author: Chinese Proverb
text: Only the healing art enables one to make a name for himself and at the same time give benefit to others.

author: Andrew Saul
text: Medicine is aptly described as an art, not a science. To this end, four different doctors may have up to four different diagnoses or prescriptions.

author: William J. Mayo
text: The aim of medicine is to prevent disease and prolong life; the ideal of medicine is to eliminate the need of a physician.

author: James Bryce
text: Medicine, the only profession that labors incessantly to destroy the reason for its own existence.

author: Thomas Edison
text: The doctor of the future will give no medicine but will interest his patients in the care of the human frame, in diet and in the cause and prevention of disease.

author: Mother Teresa
text: Doctors can heal the body, but it is music that uplifts the spirit.

author: John Wooden
text: In spite of all that doctors know, and their studies never end, the best cure of all when spirits fall is a kind note from a friend.

author: Plato
text: The greatest mistake in the treatment of diseases is that there are physicians for the body and physicians for the soul, although the two cannot be separated.

author: Bernie Siegel
text: As doctors, we are not trained to communicate and understand the power of our words as they relate to a patient’s ability and desire to survive.

author: Irving Kirsch
text: Patients who trust their doctors and have a psychological expectation of getting better could trigger a reaction in their body.

author: Dr. Bernard Lown
text: Do as much as possible for the patient, and as little as possible to the patient.

author: Sigmund Freud
text: The doctor should be opaque to his patients and, like a mirror, should show them nothing but what is shown to him.

author: Norman Cousins
text: Each patient carries his own doctor inside him.

author: Giorgio Baglivi
text: Let the young know they will never find a more interesting, more instructive book than the patient himself.

author: Nancy Dickey
text: Sometimes, the best thing we can do for our patients is to tell them what the best behavior is and then negotiate something they can live with.

author: Dr. Amir Qaseem
text: Physicians and patients.

author: Paul Farmer
text: I’ve been asked a lot for my view on American health care. Well, ‘it would be a good idea,’ to quote Gandhi.

author: Martha Beck
text: People are so afraid of authority figures, and doctors are authority figures.
